Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable, family-friendly resort!”
Reviews.Author: blb724
Reviews.Content: Wow - where to begin... I lived in the Phoenix area in the 1990's. My family hasn't returned there - together - in over 10 years. Boy, have things changed! My husband and I were searching for an affordable place, close to the city, that was "family friendly (we have a six-year-old son)." After researching private rentals, resorts (including the AZ Grand)....for what seemed to be an eternity....we found the Legacy. At first glance, I was concerned about how "family friendly" a golf resort would be, and I remember this area wasn't the best years ago...I searched and searched online and couldn't really find any "totally bad" reviews about this place - some people mentioned noise issues....some comments about rude staff....and the other biggie were complaints from singles or seniors about all the kids around the pool, resort, etc.. - THOSE reviews SOLD THE PLACE for us! I wanted a rental where our entire family could feel comfortable - including our child. He's not some out-of-control nutcase - but he does like to jump and swim in pools...and, sometimes, he can get excitedly loud....so I wasn't interested in staying somewhere that frowned upon children. After looking at hundreds of photos online (yes - the pool IS that awesome), video's, etc., we booked a one-bedroom suite. When we arrived, it was apparent the area had changed A LOT in a decade. The grounds and area surrounding the resort were beautiful and well-manicured! My allergies were actually going nuts from all the flowers and trees around the grounds. From the get-go, we were greeted by nothing but friendly, helpful staff. The concierge hit us with the "time share" pitch once - which we declined...and we weren't bothered with it again. Our request for a second floor unit was honored and we were located in Casita 6 - which was a bit away from the main check-in area and pool. I kind of liked that - honestly, the units close to the pool seemed too "busy." If you are interested in solitude, I definitely wouldn't recommend staying in them (and they are more expensive). The pool opens at 7 a.m....complete with music and lots of boisterous, festive sun bathers. Casita 6 was the farthest from the main area....and it still was only about a five minute walk up to the pool and main, common areas. THE CONDO LAYOUT: Just an FYI - each building seems to house four one-bedroom units (two upstairs, two downstairs) and four jr. suites. If you rent a one-bedroom, your unit will be on either end of the building - sharing only one common wall (if you are on the bottom, you share the ceiling, too). The jr. suites are wedged in the middle....hence, if you get one of the jr's - especially on the lower floor - I could see how they could be rather noisy (all walls, except for the floor, are shared). SO, if you want a quieter experience?? Rent the one-bedroom, upstairs....or, at the very least, request a jr. on the top floor! Oh, and building 12 is the only "smoking" building - something to keep in mind if you smoke OR are allergic to smoke... The one-bedroom was beyond perfect! Over 800 sq. feet with a patio, full kitchen, dining room table, washer/dryer, stall shower AND HUGE Jacuzzi tub. Everything was neat and clean. The fold out couch accommodated our son perfectly....and the king-size bed in the bedroom was gigantic. We had some issue's with the Wi-Fi - the front staff was responsive and helpful...but I don't think the problem was on their end. I would recommend bringing a LAN cable to wire into the internet. Our room had one in it. Housekeeping came every day - including Easter! We called a couple times for extra towels and tp - the response was beyond speedy. Although I am not a golfer, the course looked gorgeous! They really take care in landscaping this place. The pool was the best I've seen at a resort...maybe ever (and I actually enjoyed hanging out there all day - anyone out there with kids knows what I'm talkin' about....you get tired of spending hours are the same-old, dull, square-tangular hotel pools...and the kids always wanna hit the pool). In addition to the main pool you see in the photos, there was a small, circular "child" pool (only 1.5 ft. deep)....it was about the size of a Jacuzzi. Speaking of Jacuzzi’s - they have two: one for everyone and one for adults only (in a separate, quiet area). Pool also features a giant-sized chess set, ping-pong table, bar and grill area, towel service an lots of seating. FOR THOSE CONSIDERING THE AZ GRAND: About mid-week, we got word from the Legacy that the pool would be closed one day for maintenance. Of course, we were disappointed...however, the Legacy worked out an arrangement with the nearby AZ Grand Resort; guests could use their pool for the day. I was actually happy about this as we looked at the Grand as a possible place to stay (we were intrigued by the water park and reviews...however, the price was a bit out of our range and the room looked small....so we went with the Legacy). We showed up at the Sedona pool at the Grand....and we COULDN'T BELIEVE HOW DUMPY this place was in comparison to the Legacy!!! I was so happy I didn't shell out $$$big bucks to stay there. The Sedona pool was very small, we couldn't even find a place to sit....and outdated. We actually SNUCK INTO the Oasis water park (am I bad?) - and it reminded me of Disney World....just totally busy and hectic.....no seats....disgruntled staff....yeah, the Oasis water park looked neat - but you know what??? After an hour in the wave pool, my son found us and asked if we could go back "home" to the Legacy because he was tired of the place. I was shocked by the Grand - when I lived in Phoenix, it was known as the Pointe at South Mountain. If was a premier resort BACK THEN. Except for the water park - and the $$ fancier price - it still looks like The Pointe...only 20+ years older with no updates. I know they have added on in area's....but, for what they want a night?? I was less than impressed.... Let's see....what else..... They Legacy did have daily planned activities (crafts, hikes, games) - something for everyone. We didn't have a chance to attend any, though. There is also a playground, on-site restaurant, bb-que area, shuffle board and tennis. Lots of attractions nearby (Gallagher’s has GREAT food. It's at the corner of 32nd and Baseline...travel through the Grand, up 48th St. and visit South Mountain Preserve for ALL LEVELS of desert hikes. The preserve is near the Pointe's/Grands golf course - you'd never even know it's there if you weren't looking for it....and there are miles and miles of serene trails. Another great attraction is the sunset "steak run" horseback ride through South Mountain. Even if you HATE horses, you have to try this. You saddle up and ride through the park at dusk, to a steakhouse. After dinner, you ride back through the park at night - you can't beat the views! And, the Desert Botanical Gardens and Papago Park are a must see....also, on the off chance you get a rainy day and need to go somewhere indoors with the kids, try Amazing Jakes (Google it - too much to list)). The only "complaint" I really had was one morning, the city of Phoenix turned off the water to our unit....which was a little inconvenient....but that's about it...and the water was back on within an hour or two. SO, if you are a family thinking this "golf resort" won't welcome your kids??? THINK AGAIN! BOOK IT!! It's an awesome value....so much so that I'll be returning in August (for a rate less than $80 a night for a one-bedroom?!?!?! GREAT!). IF you are a single or a senior looking for a quiet get-away?? The grounds and golf course are lovely. Just be aware that there are lots of kids staying at this place....you will be outnumbered :) If you're looking for complete solitude and are bothered by boisterous vacation-goers - you may wanna try Sedona, Sun City or Fountain Hills.... I will never stay anywhere else - my family would kill me!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: medako
Reviews.Content: We needed a place as a "home base" for our stay in Arizona and this was a perfect choice. This is an actual community and HUGE! We had to do a late checkin and they had no issues with that. Got us set up and let us know everything that was being offered. Found our building and our suite without incident. I will say that the parking spots seemed small. Our room was beautiful, a kitchen, bathroom, lounge area and bedroom. Great view from the balcony. All the extras you can imagine. Beautiful pools...and the smell of lilacs perfumed the entire location. I did have a bit of a problem with how thin the walls are. We could hear the guy in the next room snoring. So either he was incredibly loud or the walls are paper. Other than that...great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for spring break!”
Reviews.Author: pgenevieve
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my husband for our spring break. He is an avid golfer; I am not but that didn't stop me from having a wonderful holiday at the Legacy! Pros: manicured grounds, spotless rooms, awesome food, wonderful pool area, oasis of greenery in the desert, top notch driving range and practice greens, barbecue area, very accommadating staff, lovely views, wonderful flowers, fees like you are in the country in the middle of a huge city, The Farm, which has three restaurants, a garden, a massage place and a artisan boutique is a 7 minute walk away, another golf course, the Raven is a 25 minute walk Cons: can't really walk to any nearby shops or food stores; thin walls but who stays in their room all day? Old and small TV sets but again, who goes there to watch TV? The annoying part, being a little bit hassled to attend time share presentations. We were asked twice but they must have had their quota because they didn't call us back to attend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: jaszysmommy
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying here, we we're pleasantly surprised, the gardens and grounds are all well maintained, very clean and pretty. The rooms are clean, but a little dated. Flat screen TVs would be a nice addition. We had asked to have a second floor room, close to the pool, but got neither, they were pretty full though, so they may have had limited availability to meet our request. On our last night our daughters bear was inadvertently removed from the room by housekeeping, and to our surprise they managed to find it and return it to us before we left. Thank you to Emily at the front desk !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: kymbir
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at the Legacy when in Phoenix for Valentine's Day. The Legacy was very good a fitting our needs. I should start by saying that we are not golfers so we did not use the course, but it appeared to be well cared for and effectively managed. The course was not crowded and had a mixture of those walking and using carts. We were disappointed that they would not let guests walk the course unless they were golfing. The resort is in a rather sparse neighbourhood without a lot of areas to walk so it would have been nice to walk the course at sunset. Having said that the ammenities of the resort were great. There was more than enough parking, the pool area was well maintained and looked like it would have been very inviting. Unfortunately, it wasn't warm enough to use it while we were there. The unit's themselves (we had a one bedroom unit) had a very nice layout with more than enough space. The bathroom and tub area were separate and the jacuzzi tub was a nice touch. We were able to buy a few things for breakfast and prep them in the unit before heading out for the day which was nice for cost control. This would be especially good for families I would think. Checking in and out was easy and we arrived quite early (around 11:30) and our room was ready for us right away which was a nice surprise. Also the resort is close to the airport and easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Legacy Golf Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sandy-Theo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort.Nice pool, great golf course, and comfortable accommodations. Good location.Friendly,helpful staff. Property and rooms are beautifully maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: WindshearDon
Reviews.Content: We have a timeshare at the Legacy and have stayed there over the past 4 years. It keeps getting better each time and the property is immaculately kept. The only detractions were in the check-in and playing tennis. We arrived at 5:15pm and our room wasn't ready! We were told to come back in an hour which we found unacceptable but the manager was reluctant to extend any consideration for our inconvenience. The tennis courts are in poor shape - one was totally unusable. The other has deep cracks. Other than these issues - the resort has a fantastic golf course which has some nice promotions to keep it affordable. The restaurant is worth a visit. The gym and spa are also very good. The pool area is wonderful for all ages with three hot tubs for varying ages (one is adults only). The units have been well-maintained and offer nice appliances. Overall this was a great vacation and would have been perfect if the check-in and tennis courts were better.

Reviews.Title: “A Place for Vacation - Not Business”
Reviews.Author: IMFLYBOY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Legend Golf Resort because it's on my company's recommended list of places in Phoenix where I could stay. I checked in late and the check in was efficient and friendly. During the process, I was directed to drive to one of the out buildings where I would find my unit. She added a footnote: Parking is first come first served. When I got to the building, I found out why she made a comment on the parking. There wasn't any. I had to drive about a half a mile away to find a spot and walk back to my unit. Not a good start. I entered the room which was a studio with a small kitchenette. As i walked through the room to assemble my stuff, I notice a creepy crawler on the bedspread. I'm not sure what kind of bug it was but I quickly trapped it in a glass and carried it outside for a proper release. That sent shivers down my back. But I never saw another such creature during the remainder of my stay. Not sure if it was a roach or a cricket. Other than the uninvited guest, the unit was clean and with the exception of a strong smell of chlorine, was comfortable. I spent 4 nights in this room. The bathroomm was clean and everythign worked well. The third checkmark on the negative column was the lack of bottled water in the rooms. Most hotels offer complementary bottled water because the city water is just so bad. No water. I ended up having to walk back to my car and drove out to find a convenience store. Still no parking when I returned. All in all, the stay was comfortable. Plenty of hot water and it was quiet. But it is not near any shopping or restaurants so a car is a must. There is a restaurant in the main building but it was closed when I checked in. The room had WiFi which was reliable and reasonably fast. I won't come back to this place as a hotel guest. If i were a golfer, it may be a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Started poorly, but finished great!”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Legacy for a business conference that was being held at a nearby resort, The Arizona Grand. I spent 4 or 5 days going back and forth between the two resorts. Of the two, The Legacy was far superior, in my humble opinion. But it didn't start out so well. To make a long story short, my only complaint during the week was with the front desk staff. Otherwise, the entire experience got better and better, from the immaculate grounds and facilities, to the pro shop, to the restaurant (several outstanding meals, including a $19 meal that tasted like a $70 meal), to the room, to the golf course, to the atmosphere, it was a very nice experience. I would rate it 4 to 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good out of school breaks”
Reviews.Author: dipex
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in February but what I thought would be a quiet and relaxing environment turned out to be noisy and with kids everywhere. For two nights I had difficulty sleeping because of the noisy neighbours. The walls are very thin and one can hear every sound from adjoining rooms. After the first night I asked to move to a 2nd floor (top floor) but the front desk was less than understanding and not helpful in any way. I was a nuisance. Front desk said we are full (but was it so difficult to simply reallocate rooms - I wasn't asking for an extra room?) This spoiled an otherwise ideal choice. Lovely grounds and good club room meals. Didn't use the pool because of the onslaught of kids. Didn't expect this in a golf resort. Didn't use any other facilities in this resort. Room was comfortable with good provisions.The bath tub was narrow and with the shower above, made showering somewhat difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ballyeamon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving and it proved to be comfortable and convenient for us. The place was clean and provided for all our needs. The grounds were lovely and the staff efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: November9999
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and had useful amenities like a fridge, microwave, and washing machine. It was a little ways from downtown Phoenix, so rental car was necessary. My only real complaint is with the concierge. While one of the concierges seemed knowledgeable, we kept getting stuck with the clueless one who had to google everything we asked her about (basic things like restaurant and tour recommendations). The other slighlty annoying thing is how they keep trying to sell you on a time share at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort with Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: pjbaade
Reviews.Content: I recently exchanged some RCI points for a 4-night stay at this beautiful resort. The grounds were immaculate, the personnel were friendly and helpful, and my 1-bedroom unit was spotless. It was too chilly to use the pool but it looked clean and inviting. My building was so quiet I could have heard a pin drop. The location was convenient to downtown, freeways, restaurants, and casinos. Highways to scenic areas like Sedona and the Grand Canyon were only minutes away. I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “trip to phoenix”
Reviews.Author: ltdmcc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were down for the Nascar race and made a RCI exchange for this property. We were not disappointed, the room layout and ameneties were very nice, and clean. The resort itself if very nice although rooms are a little far from the pool/spa and other services. I would not hesitate to stay here again. The stores are close and convenient and has good freeway access.

Reviews.Title: “Large but noisy resort with lots of ammenities”
Reviews.Author: FromEUtoIA
Reviews.Content: Check-in was pleasant & quick, and we appreciated the concierge not wanting pitch a sales pitch. We noticed right away this resort having ‘We strive for 5 star’ and we ‘Go Green’ publications throughout. For starters, we were surprised to find this nice of a large resort on this side of Phoenix. We agree it being close to a lot of conveniences but did not see this much of an advantage between being located on the Northern side of Phoenix/Scottsdale. There is definitely a difference in the ‘curb appeal’ of surrounding neighborhoods! Our 1-bedroom unit turned out to be generously sized with many conveniences. Décor is definitely more dated than other 4 star resorts we stayed in. Some make-shift end tables, improvised cabinet shelves, not very functional dressers, and uncomforatble couch and chairs leave room for improvement. The curtains, especially around the patio door looked fine at first but were right out filthy on their back side. The bathroom set up was nearly an overkill in side and duplication of sink area, and the unit lacked kitchen storage as it appears a former pantry had been converted into the make shift laundry area (doors didn’t close). However, we appreciated having the laundry area!! The most unpleasant experience was that this resort has proven to be VERY noisy. We realized this was a much larger resort than some of the other 4 star resorts we previously stayed. Based on the many coming and goings, we assume this resort also caters extensively to cooperate day guests of surrounding companies. The noise created by housekeeping/maintenance staff with their partially squeaky mini-carts and ‘set on extra load’ walky talkies is no excuse however. It was virtually impossible to get in a quiet sunbath on the private deck or sleep in past 8 AM without any disturbance! Many times the noise lasted until late and started before 7 AM. As for the matter of ‘going green’. We have seen a number of positive efforts but are convenienced these may be just for marketing purposes. Again, there is room for improvements. We have seen water been wasted intensely more than once! Washing down the exterior of a building to wash away beer bottle caps and lint left behind from previous guest, could have easily been done with a broom. A broom would have done fine. Letting the water run into the grass or walkway for some time while one tries to find the right connector for the extension hose is being lazy and NOT energy efficient. We still would award this resort a 3 – 4 Star. Considering the amenities and location, we agree this resort offers a great stay for the executive cooperate traveler. We would NOT recommend this resort to friends who want to experience a relaxing resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “Has left a bad taste in our mouths”
Reviews.Author: Gail S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Legacy Golf Resort over a half dozen times -- obviously we have had good experiences in the past. We've had a growing disatisfaction with them the last few times -- keep saying we'll find another place to stay for our Phoenix trips, but have kept going back. I think our trip last week was our last visit there. Nothing major wrong, just have had it with the additional charges they have tacked on over the year -- we've stayed in a room overlooking the golf course every trip, yet this year it was a $10 per day upcharge (this was announced at the desk, not when we booked); and a $10 per hour fee for late checkout, when we've asked for and received late check out for no additional charge every other visit. Additionally, it is disappointing to us that there has never been any acknowledgement of our repeat business -- not even a "welcome back." In a day and age when loyalty is rewarded and respected at the grocery store, the gas station, at restaurants and even the dry cleaner, you would think a vacation resort would would at least acknowledge a return customer. I travel on business and consistently get "welcome back" comments when I check into a hotel for a return visit -- also get emails and mailings with offerings to entice me back. So, we will look around and find another location in the Phoenix area that DOES want and respect our repeat business, rather than nickeling and diming us to death. Bummer, because it is a rather nice place to stay, but they're lack of customer service and awareness has just left a really bad taste in our mouths.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: LonelyTraveller77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the legacy Golf resort for months together on many occasions and nevr felt homesick. It's definitely on of the nicest sub $100 hotels I've stayed in. The lovely layout of the suites, set amidst golfing greens and the hills in the backdrop make it a relaxing place. Even the regular suite is quite a roomy studio apartment with a spacious patio. I usually pick the ones overlooking either the pool or the hills. The kitchenette is well equipped and I would cook full fledged meals for myself. The HUGE salted swimming pool is the highlight of the place. Partitioning it into 2 was smart, because it allows the splashers to be on the curvy fun side leaving the swimmers in peace to do laps. The salt water is easy to float in and you can spend hours in the water without smelling like Chlorine. I love this pool in winter. It's kept at a perfect temperature when the ambient is close to freezing. The hot tubs by the the side are lovely too. I found the room service adequate, my room was cleaned well every day. I found the staff to be polite and helpful in general. I never used the gym, though I have peeped in, and it looked good. The movie rental service is decent, but their book collection is inadequate. The only part about this place, that i didn't like was the restaurant. The food is below average (very greasy and cheesy) and the service is abysmal. I found the restaurant staff to be very indifferent. I ate very few times in there, I either cooked or drove outside to good restaurants in Tempe, Chandler or Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: john t
Reviews.Content: worst place that you could pick to stay at,service is very bad and rooms are even worse!

Reviews.Title: “Legacy Golf Resort”
Reviews.Author: JanR2011
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable, clean and roomy, although furniture had not been updated for a while. We did not have any internet service the whole week so computer or e-reader could not be used. Staff blames AT & T, but it's funny how they had internet service. Staff knocked on our door 2 mornings at 7:30a.m. and woke us up. We thought that was strange and didn't answer. I guess we should have used our do not disturb sign. Who knew! Although I felt safe at the resort, the surrounding area was a little undesirable. Since we are not golfers we used the resort as a home base for other activities we had during our week's stay. Next time in Phoenix, I will check out the Scottsdale location instead.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort...beautiful pool, very peaceful property.”
Reviews.Author: CruisinThruLife
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend and just love the pool at this property. The backdrop is South Mountain and the beautiful architecture and surroundings make it a great getaway to relax. I don't even golf, but have heard from other guests its a nice course. This is my 3rd visit here and I will continue to stay here when in Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: TirelessTravelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before an early flight out the next day. Room nice & clean.

Reviews.Title: “Warm days and cool nights”
Reviews.Author: Travnur
Reviews.Content: Our son moved down here after graduating with a BA but was unable to get a job in our home state of Michigan. February is a great time to leave and my husband had a winter break so even though we paid for 7 days we only stayed 5. We had a studio first floor unit that looked over the golf course. My husband is a golfer but I am not so we didn't stay here for that reason. It is close to our son's work and 15 min. from his apartment. We never had any communication with any staff. There was a large convention that week so we also were unable to use the restaurant. However, there is a large variety of restaurants within a mile. Gallaghers is just down the road, so we did have to try it since that is our last name. We were starving so everything tasted really good and we did get a free glass too. The food is standard bar bistro fare. We also ate at the Russler's Roost just up the mountain from the resort. That was an experience. Come hungery as servings are generous. As the name suggests it is primarily steaks, barbaque etc. Each of us had something different and all of it was excellent. We arrived after sunset and could see the lights of the city from our window table. We would stay here again as it was close to everything that we were doing. The grounds are beautiful with lots of flowers. I was also able to get lots of beautiful sunset photos with the palms in the forefront.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: plug42
Reviews.Content: let me start by saying all those people who call this resort have to be blind and stupid . this is the nicest resort i and my family have ever stayed in .the rooms are fantasic clean well kept the room service what u get is top notch.the faciltys on the site are second to none.as a british family we picked this hotel because of the location yes u do need a car but that was my choice .the pool is fantastic and the golf course itself is amazing . u cant fault anything or anybody in there help and hospitality.once again i would like to thank all in this fantastic resort.

Reviews.Title: “For the money this is My favorite course to play”
Reviews.Author: One2soarhi
Reviews.Content: I think this course is generally one of the most consistently well kept in the city. I enjoy the course and on days you don't want to play a round the driving range offers great opportunity to sharpen your skills. There are higher end courses that cost a lot more that I have played that I just don't enjoy as much as this one. You have to try it.

Reviews.Title: “loved it and already planning for another visit!”
Reviews.Author: 33toni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Legacy for 3 nights over the first weekend in August and loved it! Our room was a second-floor suite, with the one bedroom and a sleeper sofa - my husband, myself and our 12 year old son. The king bed was very nice/firm, as well as the sofa sleeper. Everything was immaculate and extremely well maintained. This included everything in the room, the outside grounds and the pool. We were in a unit rather far from the pool, but did not mind the walk. The grounds are beautiful, shady and grassy, so walking, even in the heat, was pleasant. We spent time at the pool each day. There was a nice mix of people - older, younger, in-between and some with kids. The rooms are arranged so that there is the suite on the corner with a studio connected next door, if you choose to reserve both. No one was in this studio however, so it was very quiet. We heard NO noise at all from anywhere! Next time we hope to stay longer, maybe the whole week. We will also get the king suite with the attached studio, they are attached together by a doorway inside with a private entrance outside as well. The studio also has its own balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property”
Reviews.Author: phxgirl78
Reviews.Content: I stay at this property when I visit friends and family. There are plenty of options of things to do in the area. Golf, nice swimming pool, hiking, as well as platy of other options in the area. They offer three different unit sizes. I've thrown quite a few pool parties here. I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean resort; but need to add a few things.”
Reviews.Author: IMarriedBob
Reviews.Content: We were in Phoenix for a weekend of baseball and selected a one bedroom unit at the Legacy. The rooms are a bit dated (the bedspreads and towels were quite worn) but clean and quiet. We had our own balcony (shaded) which was very nice. The rooms themselves have a few nice "bonus" entities: dishwasher with soap; kitchen stocked with dishes, blender and toaster; laundry (bring your own soap); coffee (single pot serving)) Other than dated linens, my only complaint about the room was the sound of the air conditioning unit: it's difficult to complain about the a/c because when it's 105, you're thankful you have it but still, it is VERY loud. and must run all night long. Other than that, the room is certainly not luxurious but for the price it's clean, has a nice shower/tub, multiple sinks, DVDs player. Now the not so good: The pool area. While the area itself is clean, it is severaly lacking in umbrellas or cabanas for shade. We just couldn't believe it. The only umbrellas are at the tables. They seriously need to add umbrella stands by every 4-5 chairs. Plus, they need to have the workers (who just sit there anyway) occassionally wet down the concrete. It was so hot, I fried the bottom of my feet just trying to get to the pool; unbelievably hot. The other pool complaint: there are no restrooms by the pool. you had to leave the area. Not very convenient; especially for families. Overall: the location is great. If you are planning on staying in the area, you are very close to a shopping area with groceries, salons (got a $25 pedicure - AWESOME), chain restaurants, movie rentals, etc. They need more shade on the grounds, but it was very clean and groomed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value...spotlessly clean!”
Reviews.Author: bdostal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night earlier this month based upon reviews here. We were VERY impressed with the cleanliness, and the SIZE of our room! It was a suite with a fully stocked kitchen...AND even a washer and dryer! For less than $100 for the night...it was amazing!! It was nicely decorated...and VERY quiet. We weren't there long enough to enjoy the amenities...but the pool looked nice...impeccably groomed grounds, and meticulously CLEAN!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: AustinsGranna
Reviews.Content: Best place we have ever stayed in our timeshare swaps. Exceptional service staff, fast checkin and checkout. Very helpful! Midweek cleaning was exceptional, walked in to a wonderfully clean smelling condo. Had to do NOTHING upon departure, not even take out trash or load dishwasher. All around great stay. Will definitely stay there again if back in the Phoenix area. Oh yeah, and the tour we took to the grand canyon, (not booked through the resort) picked us up at the lobby! Legacy made our trip to a convention a home away from home and a wonderful asset to our comfort after a long day of meetings. Due to our schedule, did not check out any of the activities. Highly recommend it. High speed internet was always working. Not as fast as what I'm used to, but totally sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “the lovely legacy we will return”
Reviews.Author: stevekathybithell
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the legacy and it was verything we had remembered and more The staff are so friendly, the grounds so clean, the pool is lovely and the golf course a pleasure to play so well manicured, I di not lose ne ball in three rounds. The food is excellemt and the bar staff so pleasant all in all a magical end to our honeymoon

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: Melli244
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two small children stayed in a one room condo and loved it!! The condo was spacious and clean. The bathroom was wonderful with a huge shower and a large jacuzzi tub. The employee's at the resort were just wonderful, when we would call for anything we needed they would be at the door injust a few minutes. They have alot of activities for the kids which they enjoyed. The pool is large and not crowded the only thing with the pool is from most of the buildings you have to drive to it but we got used to it. We would definatley come back, we enjoyed every minute :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Not too distracting for business travel”
Reviews.Author: pdxmark2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Legacy Golf Resort several times while traveling for work in Arizona. Despite the fact that it's a golf resort and largely patronized by people on vacation, I think it's a nicely maintained resort with spacious rooms and quiet enough that it I don't feel completely distracted and out of place as a business traveler there. My stays have occurred in Spring and Summer, however -- not sure what it's like in the Arizona high season of winter. Legacy is a fairly spread out property with multiple buildings. I usually get a King Suite with a separate sitting area and kitchenette. Ypu typically will need to drive from the clubhouse (where reception is located) to the building where your room is located. The buildings seem to have 8-10 units each, some on the ground level, some on the upstairs. Because I'm there as a business traveler, I can't really comment on the vacation-oriented amenities. The pool looks nice as I walk by. There's a significant timeshare element here, but when you are there on business, there's zero pressure to talk to the sales staff. Location-wise, it's a couple of miles from I-10, but thusfar, traffic hasn't been a problem getting to and from the Interstate, even at rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Delivered & More”
Reviews.Author: HappyGrad
Reviews.Content: I went out with my husband, 3 year old son and family to celebrate my graduation. We got a 2 bedroom condo (connected unit) and paid the extra for golf course view/close to pool. We had one of the best experiences ever. It's SO close to the airport and everyone was so nice. Shaun at the front desk was maybe the nicest guy I have met in customer service in a long time. The folks at the golf course were great. I guess my only complaint was that tee times seemed to be on top of each other, or perhaps they tried to squeeze in a corporate contest, because we felt rushed by groups behind us and were waiting over 15 minutes at each hole for 12 guys in front of us by the time we got to the 12th hole. We gave up and went home, so we lost out on that. I wanted to complain to see if we could get some $$ back but my husband said it probably would not matter. We would have stayed to play but had dinner reservations. It was too bad b/c for a public course it was excellent. Everything else was great--breakfast outside, quiet and relaxing rooms. I was worried b/c a lot of reviews said the walls were thin and I am a light sleeper,but we had no problems at all. I loved sipping a beer on the patio at sunset and time in the jacuzzi tub, which easily fit me and my 6'7" husband. There is not much directly outside of the resort, but with our GPS we found close by grocery stores etc. to stock our kitchen,and the hotel gives you a lot of info of what is close by. It was nice to have a kitchen and washer dryer--we all went home with bags of clean clothes! Most of all we enjoyed the beautiful grounds and friendly service. We all wished we had another day at the resort, and that is the sign of a good vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDadof4
Reviews.Content: My wife and four children stayed at this beautiful resort and found it to be spotlessly clean, and the entire staff to be incredibly courteous and helpful. Although we didn't play golf during our stay, we used the other amenities including the pool, restaurant and exercise center, all of which were well maintained, clean and large enough so there was enough room for all that wanted to use those facilities at the same time. Even the grounds keeping staff were meticulously dressed and courteous as you walked past them. When eating outside at the restaurant, there was a wonderful view of the gorgeous golf course. We loved being able to purchase food and drinks while at the pool which is important when you have children who want to have a brief snack and then get right back to having fun in the water. We loved the free wi-fi provided since we had two laptops with us. The connecting rooms we had were each large and very clean with everything a family would need to be comfortable, including a kitchen and washer / dryer. I would rate this resort very highly in regards to customer service and appeal. We highly recommend this resort and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Hammer222222
Reviews.Content: Great golf experience, challenging but fair. Rooms are very tastefuly decoraded and spacious. Nice resort overall. Very quite and relaxing. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, Even After We Left!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlnMama12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a trip for Spring Training (go Giants!). It was a bit out of the way from the ballpark, but close to lots of food and shopping. The grounds at the Legacy are gorgeous, and they have organized activities for kids and families. They have a barbeque night and a restaurant on the grounds. The pool area was awesome! Clean, fresh towels available, and a bar! What more can you ask for! The service was great all around. Check in was quick and easy, even though it was quite late at night. We requested laundry detergent and it was brought to our room within 10 minutes. Our room was huge for a one bedroom, included a full kitchen and washer/dryer unit and a HUMONGOUS whirlpool tub. And after the long drive from California, the most amazing thing greeted me in bed that night - AMAZING PILLOWS. It was like sleeping on a cloud. All week long, I could not get over the great pillows. After we left, I received an email survey asking about our stay. I replied with a great review, and as a side note asked if I could have the brand information for the pillows. The manager of housekeeping responded, asked for my address and SENT ME TWO PILLOWS FREE OF CHARGE! The Legacy is my new gold standard for customer service. They absolutely go above and beyond to ensure their guests enjoy their stay. If you are looking for a place to stay in Arizona, you will definitely not be disappointed with the Legacy.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: rdmcmaho
Reviews.Content: Our one bedroom suite exceeds 850 sf and includes a full sized, well equipped kitchen, washer and dryer, separate bedroom, giant bath with large jacuzzi, and a lovely separate shower. In addition there is a living room with a pull out couch. This suite is part of a nice 18 hole golf course, something I never took advantage of. The units are great for family or couples. Common areas include a giant U shaped outdoor pool, lit tennis courts, sand volleyball, and a fenced kiddy area. Indoor and outdoor maintenance are also first rate. A bonus for us was the close proximity to the airport, something much appreciated on late or early morning flights. Although this is part of the Shell Vacation Club I was never pressured into a sales pitch and only became aware of the Club through a voice mail on the telephone in the suite. This is definitely the best place we have stayed in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed period”
Reviews.Author: hbstan
Reviews.Content: As a Gold Elite member at Marriott - I've gotten tired of the circus they run in Phoenix and a friend suggested I try Legacy. I'm not a golfer but thought I'd check it out. Simply superb. I saw nothing other than top line professionalism and customer service. The one bedroom suite was great. Felt like home. The kitchen was equipped with everything anyone would reasonably need. The bed and bathroom were spotless and weren't worn out. Hello Marriott ??? ya listening ?? The grounds were manicured beautifully, the restaurant ran 6 AM til 9 PM - good food, fair price and great wait staff. All the way around, I saw nothing that I wouldn't rate 100 % - The only - thing - wasn't an issue. There was a tournament going on when I arrived and the parking lot being fuller, I had to walk an extra few step. The other guests I saw there all looked upscale. The place is like 10 minutes from the airport. Oh - and the two top things for me is a quiet place and a cool temperature in the room for sleeping. I got both of them. I have a new place to stay in Phoenix - For me ? Five stars all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Resort”
Reviews.Author: louham911
Reviews.Content: This is our sixth stay at the Legacy. We love the pool area. Pool is shaped in a horseshoe fashion with walkup bar and offers ping pong. Spring break is noisy but I love watching the kids play now that mine is going off to college. Pool area is big enough that you can escape the noise if you so desire. We rent a studio because it easily sleeps two adults and our 17 year old daughter. My only complaint is the very dated tv. They really need to catch up with an LCD and high definition.Free internet is a big plus and close to the airport. Best value in Phoenix

Reviews.Title: “Good for families but don't expect a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: SeattletravellerUW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend for a wedding. We were in a studio suite which was in a courtyard sandwiched between two other suites. The night we arrived around 11 pm our neighbor who shared an adjoining door had his TV on so loud that we could hear ever single word the person on the tv was saying. There was no seal beneath the door so you could see the light of the tv and the shadows of the people walking back and forth. We called the front desk and asked them to have them turn the TV down and about half an hour later the volume was lowered but still kept us awake. The next morning we were awoken at 6:30 am by the neighbors on the other side of us in a yelling match. Once we finally got back to sleep after that, the TV on the other side of us from the night before was on again at full blast. This TV situation happened two nights in a row and we went to bed pretty late both nights. The decor of the rooms were very outdated and need to be redecorated - they look like they haven't been updated since the early 90s. It was great to have a kitchenette and washer and dryer and when we called housekeeping to ask for laundry detergent we got some right away, so that was a positive. The pool is awesome but for how many units they have at this resort they need to add another pool. The restaurant is also very outdated but the food was decent. The beds were comfortable but the bathrooms weren't super clean - I found a few hairs in the shower and on my towel. The wallpaper in the bathrooms also needs an update. A pamphlet in the room said we could get free newspapers at the front desk so I went there very early on Monday morning to pick one up and was told they were all out and I had to purchase one from the newspaper stand for $2 around the corner. The location is in a bad area of town in South Phoenix only about 8 miles from the airport; not close to any good shopping or nice restaurants. If you want to sit by the pool all day or golf and are not bothered by outdated rooms and large crowds at the pool, I would recommend this place, otherwise go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in Hood - We Loved This Resort!”
Reviews.Author: drumdr
Reviews.Content: This place was great if you can navigate the drive-by's! You have to drive through south Phoenix to get to the resort, and we were wondering a little... if we shouldn't lock the doors type thing. However, being from AZ and frequenting PHX on a regular basis, we know our backyard fairly well. Phoenix is an overall cool place, even in the "bad" areas. Most people are cool and reviews about the neighborhood shouldn't bother anyone. The resort is located in the center of a huge property that blocks out all neighborhood blight, if someone wants to even call it that. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are stellar. We had a huge suite which wound up being a lock-off. The main room we had was incredible! Super nice furniture with a huge round dining table, back patio with reclining lawn chairs, granite counter-tops, etc... Huge jacuzzi tub, and the place was spotless. Check-in was a breeze, people were cool, and everything went smooth. This is the kind of resort I don't mind paying the $15 extra fee for. Read some of my reviews of other resorts in the area (we stay at them all!) This is a great resort if you want to frequent Tempe, Mesa, ASU activities, concerts downtown, or any downtown area events. It's a little far out of the way if you're planning to visit Scottsdale or see the Cardinals play in Glendale (plan an hour drive one way). Super cool place and would stay again in a second. Good job legacy! Send me a coupon and I'll come back this weekend! LOL.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Resort”
Reviews.Author: emerald777
Reviews.Content: Easy access to and from the airport, We found the staff to be extremely friendly and efficient. Any requests were dealt with immediately and then we received a follow up call to check that everything was ok. The resort restaurant is good and reasonably priced but if you are arriving after 9pm as we did there was no where to get a meal or a drink of any type. The pool area is excellent with plenty of sunbeds and towels and the bar area is manned by very helpful and friendly staff. We found the golf course in beautiful condition and once again the staff in the pro shop could not have been more helpful, The practice facilities were very good. Our accommodation was excellent and spotlessly clean with bed linen and towels changed daily. Our only criticism of the resort is that if like ourselves you are given a first floor suite the noise from the air conditioning units is very intrusive. The compressors are in the roof space just above the room and when all of them are working together it is like being next to a jet engine. We found sleeping very difficult on some occasions and found the only way to combat the noise was to turn the television on very loud. Sadly this was the only thing that the resort were unable to do anything about. I gather that people in the ground floor rooms do not share the same experience. Therefore our advice would be to request a ground floor room. Apart from this its a wonderful place to chill and play golf

Reviews.Title: “Great home base while in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: kokicmp
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2-bedroom (1-bedroom plus a suite) and it fit our needs perfectly. The full kitchen was great for breakfasts and evening meals. The staff members at the resort were responsive, helpful, and competent. I especially enjoyed the hike and walk led by the women at the resort's activity desk. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service, Promotes Drunk Driving in the Phoenix Area”
Reviews.Author: Medic-548
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the resort. Upon checking into the room the room was ok, a little dated but ok. The grounds were very clean. I checked in and looked to see what time the resort restaurant was open til. The book in the room stated til 10 pm. Great, I thought. Met up with some friends had a few drinks and came back to the resort. Around 9pm I decided I was hungry and would go to the restaurant, since it said it would be open til 10. At 9:10 I walked in, and waited and waited. The hostess was in a conversation with some others at the bar and just ignored me. Finally she says what can i do for you. I said I would like to be seated for dinner. She says sorry we closed about 10 mins ago. Why dont you just drive down the block to Gallahergers. I explained I had been drinking and i thought it was open til 10 pm. She responds dont worry there are no cops out here its a short drive. I couldn't believe it. I went back to my room, called a cab and went down..In the morning I spoke to the GSR at check out and she could care less.. So not only did I have to pay for a cab to go eat, which I should have been able to do at the resort, she could care less about the comments from the restaruant hostess. I plan on filling further complaints with Alchool beverage control for the state of AZ as well

Reviews.Title: “The facilities, golf course, friendliness are second to none.”
Reviews.Author: Jerryjohn31
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort three times, and it never fails to impress us. The staff is very friendly, the resort buildings and grounds are impeccably clean, and the golf course is always in imaculate condition and resonable. The rooms are well situated along the golf course with very pleasant views. The pool and tennis courts are convienient and always very nice. The restaurant offers a great selection with very reasonable prices. The resort is located with convienient access to all the major freeways which makes it very easy to get around. Overall we would recommend this resort to any and all travelers in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: capnron51
Reviews.Content: A water leak coming from the light over the tub,very noisy cleaning crew that yells back and forth as they clean. I asked three days in a row for them to stop all the noise and they said they would be done in 20 minutes. This place is Very Very noisey IT does have a nice pool and restaurant ,but if you want to be able to sleep save yourself some money and go some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: Lori23
Reviews.Content: When staying in the Phoenix area, I always choose the Legacy Golf Resort for its comfort, ease of access to the airport and downtown area, accommodating staff, comfort, satisfaction, good food, and attention to detail to name just a few. The grounds are always well kept, the pool inviting, plus the personnel really make the extra effort to see that you get what is needed to make your stay exemplary. I've brought guests most times, who loved their stay and recommend the Legacy to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again”
Reviews.Author: carrieelf
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th time staying at the Legacy, my 1st time staying in the one bedroom. I love this resort!! My daughter is a student at ASU and had to have an out patient ortho surg so we chose my favorite place and upgraded to the 1 bd. Very comfortable, housekeeping was GREAT!! Wish I could remember the young ladies name but she was very thoughtful. They even had activities for my 9yr old, thank you Dani for the tiger face painting, she and everyone else loved it!! I won't stay anywhere else, and hate giving away my secret hideaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort. Convenient Location.”
Reviews.Author: smccann4321
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Legacy a number of times over the last 5 years and it is by far my favorite Phoenix area resort. First of all, it is close to the airport in a somewhat central location in terms of the valley. Its a quick drive from the airport, very close ASU and less than a mile from the interstate that can get you started on your way to anywhere in the valley. When you drive from the airport you go through some pretty rough areas and as you get close to the resort you begin to wonder if the resort photos were for real or not. Once you get to the resort you will see it is an impressive, well-maintained complex, just like in the photos on the various websites. I've stayed in both the small one-bedroom and large one-bedroom. I wouldn't stay in the smaller unit with more than 2 travelers. Its very nice, but definitely an efficiency apartment type set up - like a nice hotel room that has a kitchen. All the rooms I've ever stayed in have been very clean and comfortable. The pool area is also impressive with lots of chairs and lounges to hang out. They have two different hot tubs and a large heated pool. They have a pool side bar where you can order a drink and they can also get you food delivered from the restaurant. All of the pool staff I've dealt with have been very friendly and helpful - which is pretty much a standard for the resort as a whole. The golf course practice area is outstanding, you can work on whatever part of your game you want to with ample space. The golf course itself is a somewhat challenging track from the tips and very well maintained. For such a nice course, its never been crowded. I've always just walked up and never had a problem getting a round in. One negative aspect of the resort is that the fitness center has some out-dated equipment and is ALWAYS crowded. Fortunately, there is an Anytime Fitness right around the corner that you can get a short term membership too for pretty cheap that is a great set up for whatever type of fitness interests you have. Another potential problem is that parking spaces can be hard to come by if you return late at night. It also seemed like there were a lot of young kids in the main hot tub in the pool area when I went there which was awkward especially considering there is a perfectly good wading pool a short walk away. If you are looking to travel to the Phoenix area, want to stay at a resort with a kitchen, like to play golf and want a location convenient to all points of the valley then The Legacy is a great option. I will always stay there when I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort, great golf course”
Reviews.Author: BarbB777
Reviews.Content: Our condo unit was very nice. We had a one bedroom and it was quite spacious. It had a full kitchen and was stocked with all the appropriate kitchen ware. We didn't use them as we ate out most nights but if we needed to it was all there. We ate at the Grill on site two nights and the food was good and the service was great. Nice cozy informal place, with half price appetizers and Margaritas and well drinks from 4:00 til 6:00. The grill is located right by the golf course and had outdoor dining. If you don't eat during the happy hour the prices are a little on the high side. Hot dog on the course was $7.50 (including chips or cookie) a little pricey for my taste. The pool was very nice with a nice view of the surrounding mountains. They have a grill and bar there as well which is convenient. There are daiiy activities but we did not use. There are tennis courts, volleyball and shuffleboard courts. Easy access to the 10 to get most anywhere in the area. I highly recommend this resort for singles or families. If you're a time share owner, your golf rate is reduced by 20%. A larger discount for owners would be nice. The living room furniture in the unit was not very comfortable for watching tv. Sofa bed with two club chairs. This was not a big deal but definitely should be a consideration in the future planning.

Reviews.Title: “to say thank you very much to the whole Golf Resort Team”
Reviews.Author: Benny70_10_10
Reviews.Content: Dear Ladies and Gentlemen I would like to take the time to say thank you very much to the whole Hotel and Golf Team for the great time we could spent in your house and on the Golf Course. We are very pleasured about your professionally in keeping the whole Resort in a brilliant and clean condition and I have to say that the Gold Team has been created by the most friendly people I ever met on a Golf Course. I hope we can enjoy staying in your house soon again. Thank you very much again and all the best to yours and you Kindest regards Kirsten & Peter Burr from Germany

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nipples
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in a studio unit that was well furnished and comfortable. The property is very nice with great amenities(pool, gym, tennis courts, golf course, etc.) The service here is what makes the place special. Kudos to all who are running this resort! From front desk and concierge people, to housekeeping to gardeners, everyone is very pleasant. We wanted to cook some pasta one night and there wasn't and large pot in the unit so I called the front desk and within in a few minutes Heidi had sent one over. Amazing!...Free use of computer in lobby was great too.Would stay here again if in Phoenix and will recommend highly to others!

Reviews.Title: “very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Lina333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Legacy for 5 days. I went for work and he tagged along to play golf. The hotel rooms/suites are called "casitas." They come with a small kitchen and full sitting area. The walls are very thin and you can hear everything that goes on upstairs and on either side of the rooms. The staff is very nice and efficient but there was one day I came back from my conference after 2pm and the room had not been cleaned. Other than that, no issues. The pool is nice and big but depending on where you are staying, it might be too far of a walk. The hotel is about 15min from downtown and about 20min from everything else my husband and I wanted to do at night but it was close enough to the highway which was a plus

Reviews.Title: “The house with the mouse”
Reviews.Author: MichiganDuckie
Reviews.Content: The trip was average to above average until the last evening when a mouse ran across the floor. The front desk was notified with no response for 45 minutes. We managed to get the mouse chased out the door and went to talk to the manager on duty - Kelly, the manager of safety and security who spoke with us and told us that they were working on the golf course grass and we could expect mice, ants, and beetles. We asked for a trap in case the mouse came back. Victor from engineering did come and was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, good space, but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: skittlebean
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to say. The one bedroom suite had a lot of space but the decor was a little tired though in great condition. The shower takes several minutes to warm up (as stated by the sign on the door). The resort was not crowded because we were in the off season but there were people above us and we could hear footsteps when they walked around. The restaurant had good food and service. I would stay here again if in town to visit people but as tourist stop. It's a little out of the way and the resort lacks a convience store.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Lynne001
Reviews.Content: This resort was beautifully located amongst the mountains. Our room had excellent views. The pool was a a lovely attraction. The grounds were attractive and well maintained. Staff were friendly and helpful. There is lots to see and do in the area if you have a car. The desert botanical gardens and the drive to Sedona or along Apache Trail to Roosevelt dam were breath taking. This is our favorite resort ever and we plan to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to relax and play golf”
Reviews.Author: Nikedog999
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the the Legacy Golf resort in Phoenix, Arizona. Our first stay at the resort was very peaceful and did some exploring of the city of Phoenix. Our second stay we decided to use the resort amenities and really relax. What a great place, the staff in all parts of the resort were first class all the way. Although they could control the weather during our stay (record heat wave, 110f-111f) the guys on golf course help us stay as cool as possible while we tried to keep from baking in the oven, on the golf course. We did make use of the pool during our stay visited the bar frequently. The pool area was very clean and the pool deck neatly setup for sunning if you could handle the heat and the mister around the bar made it comfortable while in the area, very refreshing. Overall I would recommend the Legacy to anyone visting the Phoenix area. We plan on returning on our next trip to the Phoenix area. The Legacy is the reason visit this area and also reason we are house hunting in the area. We would like to thank the staff of the Legacy Golf resort for a very pleasant stay and look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort -- good value”
Reviews.Author: kmeighannj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Legacy Golf Resort over Labor Day weekend. I had a studio which was much larger than most hotel rooms. It was great to have all the appliances including the apartment sized washer and dryer. The resort really is great value for the money. It is quite near South Mountain which has many hiking/running trails for all abilities.

Reviews.Title: “Tuesday Golf Specials in the Summer”
Reviews.Author: SeaJenniTravel
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to a golf resort. My family and I usually do a lot of camping, hiking and sight seeing on vacation, hopping from spot to spot. We spent a week at this resort in Phoenix; and traveled very little outside of the immediate area. It was wonderful. It was nice to roll out of bed and take advantage of great golf and a beautiful pool. On Tuesdays during the summer you can golf for $10; and walking this course is as pretty as many hikes I've done. Some nearby things that we did enjoy were the Science Center and The Phoenix Rock Gym. We tried a few local restaurants and saw a band play. There seems to be things to do at night outside of the resort, but by 9PM at the resort, the place is dead. If you like quiet people who go to bed early, you will like this resort. If you want to party, then you may want to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The Legacy is a legend”
Reviews.Author: Aparisbooks
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Hotels/Motels/ in most of the 50 states, I can say at the Legacy the guest is King/Queen. Having stayed at the Legacy many times over the past 3 years, consistency would be their by word. always clean beautiful rooms, good service and employees who go extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...great people...good time!”
Reviews.Author: mat'sgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Legacy Golf Resort for one week, May 15, 2010-May 23, 2010. In general, this is a nice resort with great people and we had a pretty good time! Arrived early at the resort...check-in was a bit slow but smooth. I got a bit terse initially 'cause I called a few times and requested a "second floor unit;" of course, we were given a ground floor unit. My husband and I were told to check back in an hour or so and we would be given an upper unit (which did happen). My husband and I stayed in Unit 1212 (I think)...first building, second level, unit 12...a great location. With a view of the parking lot (no biggie) our unit was clean, well-appointed, odor free, air-conditioned (temps in Phoenix reached 103 on 2 days), comfortable. While the inside of the units could DEFINITELY use a face lift (I think some of the units are undergoing renovations) and new furniture, our unit was alright. No flat screen t.v. (I don't watch t.v. but husband does, of course) but FREE direct line and wireless internet, a really appreciated touch! Small half fridge, electric burners, very limited counter space, limited cabinet space, small-ish kitchen sink, definitely okay as a partial kitchen. I wouldn't plan on cooking big meals in the kitchen 'cause it really is only a partial. Our bed and bed area were great! Bed-very comfortable, pillows-old, thinner foam (not so great but no biggie). Nice touch is the outer and inner sinks in the bathroom/shower area. Good closet space but limited dresser space (in studio we had the drawers of the t.v. armoire as dresser space). My husband sunned on our patio each morning. Air conditioner regulated without difficulty. Shower was great. Everything in room worked. No problems at all! Pool area was actually very nice! A LOT of kids and some rough-housing by teens but ample space and never a problem finding loungers even when arriving at 2:30 pm in the afternoon! Drinks by the pool bar were great! Food could be delivered upon request. Lots and lots of parking space! While the area around the Legacy is NOT the best part of Phoenix, my husband and I always felt safe returning late at night and walking from our car to our unit. The main highway to and from other parts of Phoenix and Arizona (Rte 10) is about a 10 minute ride down Baseline from this resort...convenient. However, the general area is not great and there is absolutely NOTHING within reasonable walking distance...so come prepared! Courtyards and property in general are very well kept, well-lit, gated...very pretty...do not miss the manicured ROSEMARY BUSHES that make the courtyards so fragrant!!!! Concierge gal, Helen was very very accommodating and welcoming. Set us up with a few perks after we agreed to attend the standard 90 minute timeshare presentation. Desk people were wonderful. Timeshare gal got testy with my husband and I over a minor misunderstanding. Overall, we were unleashed from the timeshare presentation much more easily than any others I have attended before...albeit we were practically thrown out-smile. Two BIG positives I MUST mention: Because DH & I missed our flight to Phoenix, we also missed our rental car date. Without an auto for two days (you REALLY need one at this resort), we ate at Trail's End Grill several times. While the food is just okay, the bartender, Tony and the waitstaff, Felicia COULD NOT HAVE BEEN NICER!!!! Husband and I had some FUN times at the Trail's End...great martinis, too! Tony & Felicia gave us TONS of useful information about Phoenix and the surrounding environs...very very helpful! Hugs all around when we left! Second thing...the front desk and housekeeping staff could NOT have been kinder, nicer and more accommodating! I realized I was without a shaver and I wanted to jump into the pool upon arrival. No problem-within 5 minutes of asking at the front desk, housekeeping arrived with several shavers and shaving cream. On another occasion, husband and I wanted more coffee-5 minutes, housekeeping was there with the coffee pods. I HAVE NEVER HAD THAT KIND OF RESPONSE AT A RESORT!!!! MY ONLY COMPLAINT...listening to the couple in the next unit having raunchy, dramatic sex morning and night (most days). WALLS ARE TRULY PAPER THIN because we not only heard them having sex but we could hear their conversations as if they were in the same room as my husband and I. This issue was a bit upsetting to me 'cause I really do not like listening to other people's conversations, let alone their sexual howls. I would not hesitate to recommend the Legacy Golf Resort to others. However, when I return to Phoenix (DH & I will 'cause we are hoping to semi-retire to Tucson someday soon), I will probably try another resort, just for variety! Please email me with ANY questions at all!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Marianlibrarian68
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful place to stay, the price is right, the location is perfect if you are flying out of Phoenix. 10 minutes to the airport but a quiet oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out if booking thru Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: pvg
Reviews.Content: I booked an inexpensive "ASU area hotel" on Hotwire and ended here. Don't know how on earth this could be considered close to ASU; I had business on the north side of campus and it would take me 30 min to drive down here via University. I debated about switching hotels, but as it was prepaid and non-refundable, I decided to try it. I would not recommend it, nor would I stay here again. As a timeshare resort, it's a step down from the Starwood and Marriott properties I already own. I don't golf and it's nowhere close to the things I would want to see here. However, it was better than some hotels I've stayed at and it was a very good value for the $52/night rate. The good: Property is large with nicely kept grounds and plenty of parking. Units are a good size. Bathrooms come with a sink, toilet and tub separate from another sink and include two hair dryers and phone in bathroom. Washer/dryer in studio unit, as well as fully-equipped kitchenette with mini fridge, full dishwasher, sink and two burner stove. New-looking Sunbeam appliances. Free internet. Balcony with lounge chairs. Unit was very clean. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Reasonably close to shopping and restaurants on Baseline. The not so good: Check-in lobby is underwhelming - small space, only one person checking people in at 6 pm. Have to get a parking pass from another person who pitches the timeshare tour. No room service. Not set up for business workers; small round table that doesn't leave much room for more than a laptop and the ice bucket. Guest binder still refers to wireless; I called tech support when it wouldn't connect, only to be told there was an ethernet cable in the room. HVAC system is very very noisy - it was constantly humming, I couldn't sleep with the noise the first night. Thin walls - could hear the tv going on one side and every conversation on the other, especially when the people were on their balcony or outside the door. No trash can for the kitchenette; I had to use the laundry bag for trash (bathroom trash can was too small). No sponge to wash dishes. Decor is a little dated, but not necessarily run-down; I found the design to be very "busy" with lots of different colors and patterns thrown together. Overall my complaints were minor, but as noted, I feel misled that it was an ASU-area hotel on Hotwire and wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you knew how long it took me to get to this Internet site........”
Reviews.Author: Havasufem
Reviews.Content: IF you are a traveler that needs internet connection; do NOT stay here! Wow. I even have the speed test from the connection that is supposed to be wi-fi (NOT) I have a LAN connection and this is the speed: http://www.speedtest.net/result/799166624.png It is sooooo bad it is ridiculous! IF all you want to do is hit balls, its cool, but anything else! HECK NO!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: travelinBB
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights at the Legacy. Our first trip to the Southwest. We'll be back to the Legacy. The grounds are immaculate. Our suite was exceptionally clean and nicely appointed. This is not a hotel, it is a timeshare facility with fully furnished condos which include a full washer and dryer and appliances. I've read some reviews regarding outdated decor. I guess I just thought it was Southwest, so didn't seem bad. Master bath was wonderful. I certainly enjoyed the jacuzzi tub. Internet worked fine and was free so my husband and I were able to keep up with work committments that we just couldn't avoid. This resort is on a golf course that is known as being very nice according to area guides. We don't golf so can't attest to that. However, we did enjoy our view of the course with palm trees and mountains in the background. We especially enjoyed watching the golfing groups deal with the sand trap. It was quite entertaining to hear them banter with eachother. I did notice that many of the rooms do not overlook the course, so if a scenic view is important to you then keep that in mind. Also, our suite had older TVs(not flat screens). Was told that the TVs are in the process of being replaced with large flat screens. The ones we had worked well and I didn't miss a flat screen. I don't vacation to watch TV anyways. Too much to see and do in the area. As for noise that I've read about from others, I can't say that was a problem for us. We were on a corner unit on the second floor so maybe that helped, but never heard anything from neighboring units and they were occupied. Loved the pool. Yes lots of little one by the kiddie pool, but if that is bothersome to you, there is plenty of area to get away from them and still enjoy the sun and water. The staff at the pool bar was wonderful. All were very friendly including the "towel person". They asked several times if we needed anything, and provided great service when we ordered drinks and food. The concierge, Joyce, was wonderful. She helped us choose a Grand Canyon Tour that matched what we were looking for and we were extremely happy with the service and our guide, Rich, was excellent. He informed us on everything from Navajo and natural history and to current events in Arizona. I can't possibly come up with enough superlatives to do him justice. We told Joyce we were interested in seeing Sedona and she recommended that we take a day trip on our own rather than pay for a tour. She outlined our route on a map, recommended the sights we wouldn't want to miss, areas to shop, and places to eat. We had such a wonderful day. She offered to help us get tickets to some of the Spring Training Games but we already had tickets for the 2 games we wanted to attend. We never did have the opportunity to eat at the resort's restaurant so can't comment on it or the retaurant staff specifically, but any other staff we dealt with were friendly, accomodating, and professional. There was a daily message on our phone asking us if we would be interested in attending the timeshare presentation. No calls that rang through, just the message. So I didn't feel pressured or even bothered. Just figured they were doing their jobs by asking if we were interested. We loved the Legacy, Phoenix, and Arizona. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: JoGrrrrl
Reviews.Content: We spent an overnight on New Year's Eve and it was a mini-vacation. Very clean, very comfortable, tons of space and a full kitchen with all the implements. And the Jacuzzi tub was HUGE! Despite a few problems checking in (rooms weren't all ready for incoming guests on New Year's Eve), the staff did everything they could to accommodate guests. And, being New Year's Eve, the noise wasn't any worse than any apartment complex experiences. We would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel and will definitely be staying there whenever we are in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Not Many better ways to spend your anniversary than golfing!”
Reviews.Author: Niagaranomad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this resort to celebrate our 30th anniversary and couldn't have been much more pleased with the experience. Yes the walls were paper thin (as read in previous reviews) but not to a point where it spoiled our holiday. Otherwise, the staff , the food when we did dine on site , the grounds and our golf experience were top notch and very reasonably priced. We would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Eight Day stay-nice resort”
Reviews.Author: SuzeQ1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, nice warm pool, nice fitness center, two hot tubs. We had the studio condo with a balcony overlooking the golf course which met all our expectations. The staff was friendly and helpful. The housekeeping is a little disorganized and often show up rather late in the day (which I've noticed often happens with condo's). The resort would like you to buy a timeshare but it was low pressure and we never went to a presentation. The resort does not allow pets (which I certainly appreciate as I believe that pets are the main vector for the transmission of bedbugs). I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and clean property.”
Reviews.Author: ludiandrade
Reviews.Content: Received a special rate thru Travel Ticker of $75p/n and after reading reviews on TA, stayed Jan 17-20, 2010 at the Legacy Golf Resort in Building 4 - Apt 4214. This was a very large and comfortable King Bed studio(time-share apartment) located on the second floor of Bldg4. Room had sleeper sofa, table with two chairs in the living area along with a full kitchenette (washer/dryer, micro, dishwasher, fridge, stove, sink, coffee maker with coffee and supplies, toaster, pots and pans and all utensils and dishes needed.) Very very clean! Bathroom is divided in two areas; one with sink and blower and closet and the other separate area with pocket door has full size vanity, sink, blower, phone, tub/shower. Plenty of towels and amenities. Housekeeping daily. Closet contains digital safe, iron and board, laundry basket and laundry bags. Room has private balcony with tables and lounge chairs. The golf course is excellent (husband played - usually plays at Biltmore or Gainey Ranch). Although other reviews state noise as an issue, we did not experience much difference than any other hotel. Walls are a little thin, especially connecting walls in bathroom but that was not such a bother. Restaurant located in Pro Shop. Did not use pool or jacuzzi due to weather. Self parking is free. Free Ethernet/WiFi in all rooms. Only catch...sales office leaves daily message at 8am (no phone ringing - just red flashing light) to invite you to their time-share presentations. No need to answer these calls. Concierge located in registration area - very helpful. Property is located near Arizona Mills (outlet mall) and many other businesses on Baseline Road.
