If distance to main Phoenix is not a problem, then this is a very nice and reliable stay. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: shimmylicious09
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES: very clean rooms, well kept grounds, quiet & peaceful (if you like that), super comfortable bed, customer service was excellent (they gave me complimentary check-out until 1pm because business was slow) NEGATIVES: room style/furniture is old-fashioned (I personally don't like that) and the most disappointing thing....NO ROOM SERVICE?? I had to get out of bed (I was TRYING to have a lazy Sunday) but had to get up, get dressed, and walk over and pick up my food from the restaurant. Call me lazy, fine. But I just wanted to relax and NOT move for one day. Note: This definitely is not a hotel. It is a resort. It's spacious in that it covers a lot of ground. It really looks like a apartment complex. I've gotten accustomed to staying at high rise hotels and this was definitely different. Not bad, just different. I can definitely appreciate it. Orange Tree Golf Resort in Scottsdale - looks similar from the outside but rooms are much more beautiful in my opinion (so is the area). But they also don't have room service. BOOOO!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, except for the paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: smbreezee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked to do a weekend getaway. We have had very bad experiences with our GPS leading us a stray. Pay no mind to the trailer park on the left before you reach the resort. The surrounding area to the north was questionable. We did venture to the south of the resort and found a nice pub. The resort itself is beautiful. Kind of like an apartment community. The grounds are well taken care of. Same complaints as some of the others. Get a second floor room and keep the TV on if you plan on doing the deed. The walls are paper thin. I was awoken at 5:30am one morning to the sound of neighbors packing to leave. I'm assuming they heard the noise we made the night before and were trying to repay the favor. Over not terrible. Took us 15 minutes to get to Scottsdale and 10 minutes most everywhere else in the city. The pool is nice and the three jacuzzi's were great. I planned on using the fitness room, but never made it. Although the room had some great equipment inside.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: C5254
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Legacy Golf Resort with some friends that booked through their timeshare. It is located in South Phoenix, south of the airport, and I normally stay in North Phoenix/Sun City area. It is a bit of a drive to Scottsdale or Sun City, anything north. But the resort itself is really beautiful. There were quite a few of us for a long girls weekend. We had shared suites. The bigger of the two connecting suites (both have king size beds), has a full kitchen, dining room and living room area. You also have a huge jacuzzi tub and a separate glass shower. The smaller suite has a regular bathtub/shower combo and a kitchenette. The decor was really striking, the beds were comfortable, it was a really nice stay, very relaxing. The only negatives were that it is kind of awkward to climb in and out of the jacuzzi, almost had to hop into it, and the shower and bathroom flooring were all in marble so made it a little slick. Also my friend actually got bit by a scorpion that was in our bedroom on the floor! She was looking for something she had dropped under the bed and put her arm on the floor and got bit. We called the front desk and they very quickly sent a supervisor down who found and disposed of the scorpion. Also they provided a staff member that was an EMT who gave her some instructions in case of an allergic reaction. I was impressed with their quick service. We realized that we were in the desert (although still in the city) and occasionally this might happen. But after that, we always checked our shoes, luggage, clothing to make sure we didn't have any other visitors! We didn't play golf but I used the fitness room every day, not crowded at all, had lots of different machines to work out on. We ate breakfast on the patio once, food was okay, the view of the golf course was very pretty, also had a view of South Mountain. There are a few restaurants/fast food places and some strip malls for shopping, Walmart grocery just down the street. The Arizona Mills mall is also close by. This resort is not too far from Tempe or the airport. Nice resort but somewhat out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Legacy Golf Resort”
Reviews.Author: hiker017
Reviews.Content: Given that we are not golfers, my husband is always a little leery about staying at a golf resort. We were extremely pleased, however, with our choice of the Legacy Golf Resort for a recent two-night stay. The staff at the front desk went out of their way to ensure that we had a great stay, and our one-bedroom unit far surpassed our expectations. The room was spacious, clean, and inviting. The bathroom was huge, and the jacuzzi tub, the dining room and the kitchen were everything we could ask for. We especially appreciated the resort's new recyling program and efforts to "go green." I would highly recommend this resort to anyone staying in Phoenix. A great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: GinaShelden
Reviews.Content: After looking around on the computer for seems months, we finally found the Legacy Golf Resort per the kitchen units, but still a resort feel. We had 7 in our party - which is always tough to please all. We had 2 seniors & 2 toddlers. I was really amazed that as soon as we got to the resort, a lady (Kelly) greeted us outside & told us she was the resort security. We felt at ease instantly! It is always a good feel when you meet someone truely as nice as Kelly. She ended up helping out our entire stay!! Also, Scott W - bartender at pool is amazing! He was super nice & made great drinks! THANKS SCOTT! Our rooms were adjoining 1207 & 1208 with golf views, South mountain views & the most desireable... right next to the pool. Perfect! The resort is beautiful - especially the grounds! Flowers everywhere! It was so perfect to be able to go out for dinner & then bring the left overs back, stick in fridge & then microwave the next day. Easy! With kids, this was pretty much needed. We will be back next year, as we have stayed other resorts & found this to be the best for us by far. One little thing... the massage set up wasn't heaven. Pretty much just a room like you can get at home. If they glamour this up a bit, it would be perfect. Plus, I got a cold shower afterwards due to water just not getting hot. :( I would go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyinCA
Reviews.Content: 1 Bedroom suite was the perfect size for 4 but apparantly the pull out bed was quite uncomfortable. Loved the pool area. Bar personnel were very friendly. Attendant included. Everyone on staff was very friendly. Ask them about the numbers they wear. They love to tell you all about it. Kitchen was well equipped. Restaurant food was very tasty although service was a little slow. Shuffle board areas lots of fun. We would definately return. A little off the beaten track and the surrounding area is a little rough but the spot is for sure a diamond in that rough. Plenty of shopping nearby to keep the kitchen stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome suite”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyM2
Reviews.Content: 10 days over Christmas...golf, travel, shop....awesome staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice large rooms in a remote area”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_WalnutCreek
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for business for 3 days and wanted a larger room with a kitchen. The facility had large rooms/suites with almost full kitchen. The staff was very nice and always wanted to know what else they could do to make my stay better. The room was nice a large, clean, had a nice kitchen, including a washer and dryer. The only downside was that the walls were a bit thin and the TV next door kept me up one night. It appears to be some type of time-share, although the sales pitch was via a room voice mail and not pushy. The pool was very nice as well as the exercise room. The wired only internet was free. The golf was not included, but the tennis courts were free. There were no extra fees. The location is remote, you need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Profound Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: reppteam
Reviews.Content: We had booked the hotel online through hotwire as our son was coming to Arizona State University as a freshman. A very good friend of ours would be joining us a few days later in his own suite (not on hotwire). At the time we requested to be situated close to each other and of course, were told no problem. When we arrived in town we went a day early to make sure that we were still able to have our friend stay in the same block with us, again, told no problem. We realized when seeing the condos in real life that our friend would want to be close to the pool, if we could be guaranteed he would be placed there too, pay for the upgrade. Keeping in mind this was all the day before our actual check in. We decided to pay the upgrade but prior to doing so was promised our friend, who was travelling with us would be guaranteed a spot in the block with us. The next day upon arrival (told to come early) we were given a map and a choice of two suites, we chose, went back to the front desk where they handed us our card keys and told us if we had not heard from them by 3 o’clock to go ahead and move in. We arrived a little after 3:00 and packed all of our suitcases and bags up the stairs to our suite, only to find the card keys we were given did not work. Myself and our two teenage girls stood watching our bags in 112 degree heat for almost an hour while my husband went back to the front desk, only to find we didn't exist and that room was given to someone else. Fortunately my husband remembered the name of the woman helping us, to no avail, she had left for the day. Finally, over an hour later, it was sorted out and we were allowed to move in. This ordeal was of great concern to us as it was obvious by the buzz in the line up at the front desk, that others were suffering from their promised rooms also been given away.We confirmed once again when our friend was due to arrive in a few days that he would be in the block with us, once again, we were told no problem. On our way back to the room we ensued a violent argument in the parking lot by a group of people that seemed to have hundreds with them overtaking the pool/parking lot/ and barbeque area, the noise from that party went on all night. The following night we entered the pool area, my husband was carrying a plastic cup and my son was carrying a can of soda. The attendant, who knew nothing about what was in the cup met us at the gates and rudely gestured for us to turn around and leave, he never asked what was in the cup, but being a highschool principal, my husband assumed bringing in soda/cup was against the rules and put it in the garbage. Once in the pool area, we realized almost every single party in there were drinking 'something' out of cups, bottles etc and the bar was closed so that couldn't be it. We pointed this out to the attendant who basically brushed it off as whatever he says goes. When my husband and son noticed that the ping pong paddles were being returned they asked to sign them out whereupon the attendant said no. It was 9:20pm and no where near closing time, finally, feeling very uncomfortable with his strange bullying we left. The next night there was a different attendant whom I spoke with as our girls were too nervous to go back to the pool. He said that the other guy was known to act inappropriately. Well, the inevitable occurred, our friend arrived, we went to check him in where he paid in full. He was given his card key in our block and told to come back after the room was cleaned at 3:00pm. After 3pm we helped him move his bags to the promised room to once again find the keys did not work..once again back to the front desk and once again told that they had no idea who gave the keys and there was no guarantees on being given a specific room. When we spoke with the manager to explain how we would never have paid for the upgrade to the block beside the pool had we not been promised our friend to be in the block we would have stayed over in the original room offered. When asked what we thought she should do, we said at least to be compensated for the upgrade we would never have sought, not being close to our friend and she decided everything we were promised about our stay had been given to us. There is actually many more smaller and petty complaints but these were just the main ones, It is safe to say we will not be back. We had planned to come at Christmas with four familes as well as have a home base while visiting our son at college for the next four years but will never stay at The Legacy again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, and comfortable units”
Reviews.Author: travels4funPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Terrific value, especially during the summer in Phoenix when it's so hot. The grounds, golf course, and units are immaculate. Pool is big, mountain views are great. The staff was friendly, helpful, and responsive. Didn't leave the resort because of the heat, but had everything we needed. This was my 5th stay, and absolutely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Blah resort, lots of resort "out of order"”
Reviews.Author: gsuds
Reviews.Content: Internet was down in most buildings,and had been down for quite a while now, which is an issue considering I needed it for work. I specifically asked about internet access before I made the reservation. Hot tub was out of order. Check-in was very poor and the check-in are is very very small and cannot fit more than 15-20 people in it. No rooms were available when I checked in at 5:30pm, 4:00pm is when you can start check-in. Parking was horrible as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Legacy and the Community--a resort or a summer camp?”
Reviews.Author: kmesaaz
Reviews.Content: Just spent a couple of nights at this truly lovely facility. However, I found that MANY of those in the pool were not registered guests, but were locals from the nearby community. The pool is not large to begin with, and with all of the kids who were brought here to swim, there was just no room. Plus, those who work at the snack bar or dispense towels pay no attention to what is going on in the pool or at poolside. You would think there was a swim up bar for all of the drinks, cans, and cups in the pool. At 10:00 p.m. when the pool closed, carloads of people left the pool, hopped into their vehicles and drove off the property. I suppose this would not happen in the cooler months, but I would not recommend this place to those attempting to relax poolside during the hot summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Some positives, major negatives”
Reviews.Author: PHXtraveler2006
Reviews.Content: I will start with the positives. The room and restaurant - both food and staff - were great. The front desk staff seemed great but several of their claims - and those on the web - were not true. We went on a package and when we checked in the front desk clerk specifically commented on the discount on the golf. When I checked in for golf the next morning they said the discount did not apply because they had a discounted rate for the weekend. It is fine, but if you have to pay the same as anyone playing off the street then there is no discount for staying there so stop saying there is. The major disappointment was at the pool. The pool itself was fine but the staff working was not acceptable. The bar staff was ambivalent at best. I presented the discount card when first ordered and they said wait till I close out the tab. I did and didn't check the bill closely - my mistake. When I checked out at the end of the stay, I double checked the bill and found out that they had not taken the discount and to add insult to injury there is a 20% gratuity that is automatically added. There was no warning about the gratuity and they even have a tip jar out. That is unethical and unacceptable. The rest of the staff was not much better. We showed up on Saturday and signed out towels. We found chairs and then started for the pool and one of the other guests told us we couldn’t go in. It turns out they had to shock the pool which is understandable, but for the person at the towel stand to not say anything or not having someone around to advise guests of what was going on is just not professional. Again at the checkout the staff seemed good but when I commented about these issues they said they there was nothing they could do as the course and pool are run by contractors. Sorry Legacy – you get judged by all the facilities and staff at the establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed after 5 stays”
Reviews.Author: 2ndGenAZnative
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here with our kids, and by ourselves, at least 5 times through out the years and love it.....even though we never play golf! About the only time we leave the resort is to go to AZ Mills mall or to Sun Splash water park. We buy our own food, seeing it has a full kitchen. They have tennis, volleyball, shuffleboard, ping pong, a pool, jacuzzi & work out room, all of which we use; not to mention beautiful views from our own balcony. The staff provide great service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for an event and accomodations for a birthday party weekend!”
Reviews.Author: PJsMom_Texas
Reviews.Content: The Legacy was an awesome place to hold my husband's birthday party golf weekend for about 35 people. Accomodations were perfect for his friends and our family! We were all able to enjoy golf, the pool and hold a dinner in his honor. The staff is wonderful to work with and very helpful! They were the ones that helped me make it as nice as it was. Highly recommend it for any kind of get together! Everyone was happy!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Diservice”
Reviews.Author: BelizeanBway
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at this resort every month, but somewhere along the line, they forgot how to treat customers. The room was not the room we reserved and the room they moved us to was loud and noisy the whole time. Didn't get any sleep and the didn't even get an apology...just a "well, you can get free breakfast" and "how would you like to make your payment." My and my fiance left dissatisfied and disgusted by the lack of understanding. Lost a good customer today.. enough to let me write this crappy review.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive treat”
Reviews.Author: arubaone
Reviews.Content: I visited Legacy Golf Resort with my BF, my sister and her son. It was one of the most relaxing, enjoyable vacations that I have taken. We are already looking to book next year for an extended stay. The rooms were beautiful and spacious. Check in was a breeze and the young lady who helped me was fantastic. The only drawback I saw was the pool area did not seem to be supervised. We observed car loads of people who were not staying at the resort piggy back to gain entry. I never saw any issues but they might want to nip that in the bud before there is one. While we were there, we got one of the best massage's ever. Very professional and Very well done. None of us Golf but next year we plan on taking lessons so we can partake in a game. two thumbs up. Way to make a East Coast girl wished she lived on the West Coast. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Superb place to stay; great facilities, including golf”
Reviews.Author: odys47
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Legacy. It is fantastic. Everything was just perfect. A great large one bedroom with full kitchen, patio, etc. Very well equipped and well looked after, with daily service. Great facilities on site at no extra charge including a pool, fitness facilities and certain activities such as walks. A great well maintained golf course at very reasonable rates for guests. Also, very close to good shopping and places to eat. Were able to use it as a base for visiting places in and around Phoenix during our week there. Access to computers provided was a plus since ours went down with a virus. Would definitiely stay there again if in Phoenix on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury vacation for a budget price!!”
Reviews.Author: aphrael129
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I decided to get away for a few days from the dreay NJ weather. We were not dissapointed. This resort is absolutely lovely, we got to the resort early and checked in at 1pm with no problems. The studio room was clean and efficient, the laundry and kitchenette a huge plus (and used daily). Location is perfect, forget what some other reviews have noted. No it is not glamourous and chic but everything you need is within 2 miles and all attractions are within 10 minutes of the resort. There were a lot of reviews about not being able to sleep in due to the landscaping, but we had no problems. Yes, the grounds are immaculate and there are always workers outside but nothing that will wake you. The restaurant was nice but a little pricy for the food. ($6.95 for 3 little waffles?) You are better off heading over to Fry's grocer and utilizing the kitchenette. The pool is sparkling and warm, but be warned, once the weekend comes so does the massive amounts of children. Although I have to admit, none were really out of line or obnoxious. The golf course was well maintained and had excellent practice facilites included with the round. There was even a reduced rate due to the high heat ($25) Overall the place was excellent and we will be staying again on our next venture out. We reccomend dining at the Farm for a "slow food" experience and Gallagher's for a local sports bar feel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room...nice location!"”
Reviews.Author: tmarconi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for nine days...service personnel were very accomodating! The room was beautiful - kept well. I liked having a small kitchenette and launderette in the room. I asked for foam pillows as I am allergic to down/feather pillows and received pillows with some sort of foam "chips" in them. They were VERY UNCOMFORTABLE. That would be my only negative comment and would suggest they correct this. You might want to bring your own foam pillow if you prefer one over a feather pillow.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant and comfortable resort”
Reviews.Author: shirgolf
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautifully maintained and the front desk staff very courteous and efficient. We had a studio with a small living room slightly separated from the bedroom area, an adequate little kitchen area and a pleasant patio. It was just fine for the two of us. The restaurant was casual and had indoor and outdoor dining areas and the menu offered a nice variety. The golf course was in beautiful shape -- cushy fairways and a nice layout. However some of the fairways run alongside a busy road, which detracted from the atmosphere. Also many of the fairways are lined with houses/condos. We didn't use the pool or the fitness center. Pay NO attention to those couple of review writers who whined that the resort was next to a bad area. There is nothing wrong with the area at all. Whoever wrote those reviews probably had just never seen different colors of people before. It was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: PrincessArlene
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Legacy Golf Resort, we were quickly checked in. Mind you, we were 24 hrs. later than expected, compliments of United Airlines who cancelled our flight to Phoenix. Our Suite was exactly as advertised -- kitchenette, bar fridge, microwave, king size bed (very comfortable), nice bathrooms, walk-out to 18th fairway on golf course. Lots of dishes, utensils, even salt and pepper shaker.....which was nice. We found room to be spotless clean and each day the maid came and stripped the bed every day (and no, husband is not getting this kind of service at home) and scrubbed everything down. Very impressed with cleaning staff for sure! This is NOT the place to Party Down -- it is lights out at 10 p.m. and the place closes down for the night. Ocassional sound in courtyard area, but otherwise, very quiet! In the area there are many restaurants (Applebee's, IHOP, Subway, Little Casaer's) and shopping (Target, KMart, Walgreens etc) about a 3 min. drive from the resort. Golf on the resort, good value as a last minute tee-time on Internet. $40 p.p. with cart incl. Course was well maintained, lots of sand sand sand and not too much water. Some challenging holes as well as Par 3's, which rounded out the Par 72 course. The only complaint I would have is that I asked the conceirge to make a reservation for me (left voice mail) and never heard a single word from them. I wound up making the reservation myself. Had a good massage, Marilyn was just lovely and worth the $85/hr. Spa was somewhat limited, but accommodating at the same time. Check-out took all of 30 seconds. Never asked or pressured for a time share presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Returning”
Reviews.Author: Europhile42
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay at The Legacy Golf Resort--and every stay has been wonderful. My grandsons enjoy the pool--and I like the convenient location to all parts of the Valley.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Randman
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised at the negative reviews and some of the experiences of travellers that stayed at the Legacy after us. I wrote a review on our return, we were there for spring break in March but for whatever reason the review never appeared so I'll try again. We are a golfing family of 4, my wife's a beginner and I have 2 boys aged 15 and 12 that are good golfers. Firstly Tony and Chris the pro and assistant pro are 2 guys that get it. We've done our fair share of golf holidays as a family and they were probably the best we've ever dealt with. The golf course is immaculate, the fastest greens you'll ever play and the fairways are like carpet. The head pro worked out a family deal for us that quite frankly was so good that we didn't have to go elsewhere to get our golf fix. The rooms were spacious but dated (not a big deal for us), the grounds as immaculate as the course, parking, yes it was a challenge after coming back from dinner out we had to park a short distance away, so what, you get to walk your dinner off and it's a beautiful evening, I could think of worst things. The Angels of Anaheim where there during our stay and that was a huge bonus for our boys. The pool is nice but would have been nicer if they had a quiet pool, they certainly have the room there and it was quite a zoo with all the kids. They did have a pool bar and music. The check in/check out was courteous and efficient. The surrounding area of South Phoenix was rough, not exactly Scottsdale but it was central to all areas of the Valley. Also great gym. We enjoyed it and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Be Very Aware This Shell Vacation Resort Overbooks”
Reviews.Author: mustangbonnieCanada
Reviews.Content: If you are a Shell Vacation Owner, as I am, be advised they will turn you away if they are overbooked and send you to another resort until they have a room available for you. As an owner who booked a 14 day stay in August of 2008 for March 2009 I am not at all impressed. Everything was confirmed through Shell even our late check in yet we were still told upon our arrival "because of OVERSTAYS there were no rooms available". We started our holiday at 7am from Canada and arrived in Phoenix at the resort at 9:30pm tired from travelling and looking for a bed. When I was told at the reception that I would have to go to another resort until a room was available I was very, very disappointed. No transportation was offered to us to this other resort just a map on how to get there. If we did not have a rental car we would of had to take a taxi and pay for it ourselves. The next morning it took me 2 phone calls back to the Legacy to get in touch with someone who would look after the problem. Isn't voice mail wonderful? There was still not a room for us but they suggested that we check out of the Resort they sent us to and bring our bags to the Legacy and once a room was available they would transfer them to our room. There was no time as to when we would be able to check in just "go enjoy the day and come back later" we were told. They did give us a coupon for breakfast to compensate but it did not even cover the cost of our food. As an owner I have never been treated so poorly at a Shell Vacation Resort how disappointing. I could go on about other points with the front desk staff giving us wrong information about the resort but I think all that read this will understand that I am not at all happy with the experience of the Legacy Shell Vacation Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull experience”
Reviews.Author: BrewersfanWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort as a central baseball spring training location and were very happy with the service, location and overall experience. The grounds were beautiful and safe to walk, the pool was very nice and not too busy and the room with the balcony overlooking the golf course was very relaxing after a double header. We got a great internet price for the week and were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre small changes would make big difference”
Reviews.Author: judycindy
Reviews.Content: spacious clean rooms. Nothing fancy loud air conditioning units loud groundskeeping early in the morning. 7 am. Good luck sleeping in. Good luck getting a view room.. They would only give us parking lot views. Probably because we hotwired it. nice pool. Some of my earrings dissappeared beds ok. would be a big improvement if they had nicer bedspreads and blankets nice grounds great weather luckily enough beds comfy except for spreads and blankets

Reviews.Title: “Save your vacation....stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: arizonatralver
Reviews.Content: The area was beautiful. Our room was nice, not great, but clean. We however did not enjoy the "Resort" due to the poor attitude of the staff. Check in was a nightmare and the staff "got even" by sending a maid to our room before 8:00 A.M. to 'clean' (according to the poor maid), when we complained. We received NO call back from the manager or the corporate offices at our request for help! We were booked for four days. RESORT....it is a joke! We felt that it was necessary to 'party' & 'play' away from the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort, great staff, memorable trip”
Reviews.Author: surfnvolley4
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to the Legacy Golf Resort for my best friend's bachelor party weekend, and we're already talking about a return trip, or even making this an annual thing. Beautiful rooms, very affordable rates, first class golf course, and a wonderful staff made this a very memorable trip. The golf course was gorgeous, well maintained, and very fun, would love to play there again. Very affordable too, just $69 for the green fees and cart. I can't say enough about the lodging either. The rooms were huge, plenty of space, patios, very nice bathrooms, jacuzzi bathtubs, etc. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Leading up to our arrival I had numerous email conversations with our sales rep and she was always very quick to respond to any questions I had. For a first time best man planning a bachelor party for 12 guys, her help was invaluable. I have absolutely no major complaints at all, just a couple of very minor things. The restaurant was not the greatest. The menu does not offer many menu choices, and the service was pretty slow. Didn't really bother us too much since we were there for a bachelor party we were pretty low maintenance. The bar in the restaurant is the size of a shoebox, a bigger bar area to hang out in, watch sports, kick back, would be nice but again, we were there for a bachelor party and had plenty of booze in the rooms. If you're looking for a great golf resort in Arizona, you will NOT be disappointed with the Legacy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Time-Warp Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: darktourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Legacy as a gift from family members for our honeymoon. We are not golfers but were excited to be at a "Luxury" resort. We had a late arrival and only had a second floor studio room option, with a view (of the golf course). The accomodation buildings are not within walking distance of the lobby and once we got to our building there was no parking! We had to park 3 buildings away and walk with our luggage to our second floor studio. There are not marked spaces for guests, it is first come first serve which is irritating for late arrivals, people having a late dinner in town, etc... Where are we supposed to park?? The studio was nicely laid out, each had a private balcony with lounge chairs and the washer and dryer in the unit was a nice touch. The bed felt old and wasn't comfy, the pillows were scant for a King size bed and were also old. The decor in the rooms was awful. 1980's southwest is how it is best described. There was never a visit from the cleaning staff, however the option existed if you were staying beyond 5 days or wanted to pay extra for it. The kitchen area was stocked with fantastic feistaware dishes which seemed too modern for this outdated property. Each morning we were woken by phone calls from the conceirge telling us to sign up for a 90 minute timeshare meeting and weather reports, activity options etc. It wasn't just annoying but considering we were on our honeymoon the last thing we wanted to do was waste 90 minutes at a meeting about owning a timeshare! The pool was not near the accomodations, it was closer to the lobby which was quite a distance away so we didn't enjoy the pool. The grounds staff are constantly maintaining and begin early each morning so the chance for sleeping in does not exist. This property is very nicely located, by the airport, shopping and the main freeways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay, Not So Much for Meetings”
Reviews.Author: bbb123SouthernUS
Reviews.Content: We have had our corporate meetings here for several years. The accommodations are excellent, with spacious rooms and excellent service. Some of the casitas are a good walking distance from the clubhouse and front desk. One drawback is that there is not a good space for meetings. A large tent is available, which overlooks the fine golf course. There is a lot of noise (mowers, planes, air conditioners, etc.) in the tent, which it makes it hard to hear. I wish the Legacy would build a real conference facility.

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget your toothpaste...”
Reviews.Author: elpasomama
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times now on business. This time I spent 3 hours waiting for my room to be cleaned before I could check in....then when it came time to check out, they were going to charge $30 plus tax to check out any time after the posted hour!! The other problem is that there is no room service and no restaurants within walking distance, except their own. There is no gift shop where you can pick up an item you might have forgotten or a souvenir for a friend. There is a pro shop for golfers. The grounds are beautiful, but the groundskeepers are blowing and cleaning all day long. I would not stay here for pleasure unless I was a golfer.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: cfirestorm
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Great price. Great golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay with All the Amenities.....but....”
Reviews.Author: lgosz
Reviews.Content: This resort has immaculate, spacious rooms with full size and stocked kitchens (watch out though for the leaky coffee maker) , awesome golf, and superb amenities. You really don't even have to leave. There are beautiful views but definetely ask to have your room patio/balcony face the golf course if you like to sit outside. It wasn't much fun enjoying a cocktail on my patio and watching cars and people go right by me and workers leaf blowing the grass right in front of me. The pool, clubhouse restaurant, tennis courts, hot tub, shuffleboard, and children's play area are all top of the line but everything closes TOO EARLY! (9 or 10pm) After a long day of golfing 18 holes and/or site seeing you'd like to come back and have a late dinner and sit in the hot tub or go for a swim and they are closed. How can a bar (keep in mind it is a very small bar) close at 10? The outside bar/grill in the golfing area closes even earlier. That was the most disappointing part of our trip. Do NOT venture outside the resort gates by foot. It is situated in a not so nice "barrio". Even the locals told us that. Don't even stop at a gas station within a mile....go farther away. If you pull out of the resort and turn right, a couple miles down the road you'll run into everything you need...grocery stores, restaurants, gas stations, shopping, etc. You are really close driving distance to tons of fun places!! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “A terrific stay at Legacy Golf!”
Reviews.Author: dm713
Reviews.Content: We are SVC owners and this was our first trip to the Legacy. It really is a wonderful resort, convenient to everything you'd want to do in Phoenix (helpful as we are not golfers). The rooms were really well done and you can't beat the jacuzzi tubs. The grounds are immaculately maintained and it was a very quiet location. I've read other comments about the surrounding neighborhood and didn't get any negative impressions myself. It is in an older part of Phoenix but by no means unsafe. There's actually a nice private farm next door which has its own restaurant. It's just a short drive down 32nd to Baseline drive, where you can go left to catch I-10 or right to get to supermarkets, restaurants, etc. We highly recommend the Legacy and will plan a return trip next year!

Reviews.Title: “Quality atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ramonabare
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the resort for a winter golf break. I returned a week later to stay for a few more days with my sister. the room was clean and comfortable and we enjoyed the pool and the service was excellent - only problem we had was noise - a young woman with triplets (toddlers) was booked in to the room next to us. Management was great about listening to concerns. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “The Bomb!!!”
Reviews.Author: sammy102
Reviews.Content: .Me and my husband just fail in love with this resort. You must check it out, There was not one thinjg bad about this resort not anything. I'ts close to every thing you think you want to do. ( You do need a car )

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort/ bad location”
Reviews.Author: threekidsplustwo
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the Legacy for a week over Thanksgiving. We had never visited Arizona and booked this resort based on favorable reviews. I would not stay here again. I will outline the positive and negative aspects of this resort. Positive: The resort sits on a beautiful golf course that my husband and boys found challenging and fun to play. The room (we had a master and single combined) was very large, clean and nice. We had a large kitchen with separate eating area, a small living room area, a very large master suite with nice large master bath. In addition, we had a separate bedroom with two beds, small bathroom and kitchenette. We had two laundry areas and two patios looking out on the golf course. The bathroom had marble vanities and the master bath had a jetted tub. It was not the Ritz, but it was very nice. The grounds were well kept and the flowers and mountain views were lovely. I was sursprised at how very big the resort is. The work out room is nice. The golf shop has much to offer. The pool is fine. It is large and there are many chairs along with a bar. It was always almost empty. The tennis courts are very nice. There is a cute children's area with jungle play set, etc. The cons: The resort is located close to the airport and very close to a dangerous part of town. Driving to the resort from the airport, you pass neighborhoods surrounded by barbed wire. While getting gas at a nearby gas station, we felt frightened of the drunks hanging out front. I did not feel safe when I left the resort for a run or walk. In the opposite direction of the hotel, you find Walmart, Target and strip malls. There is nothing charming about this location. You do not want to leave the confines of this resort in any way. If however, you are a business traveler, a golfer, or looking for a spot to stay on your way somewhere else, this is a very nice resort in and of itself. We visited Sedona (lovely) and the Westin area of Pheonix (beautiful). For a family weeklong vacation go there. This is for golf trips or short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Super Quiet and Clean”
Reviews.Author: LAfanla
Reviews.Content: Stayed Jan 1 to 4, 2009. Place was immaculately clean. Huge jacuzzi tub, seperate shower. Bed was comfortable. Full kitchen. Place was great and quiet, yet close to stores/malls (1 mile away). Close to Arizona Mills Mall, Target, McDonalds, many restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “The Legacy is a Legacy”
Reviews.Author: Arizona-Jim
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3rd stay at the Legacy Golf Resort in Phoenix, AZ. As usual it was a pleasure, being a Timeshare Resort the rooms are like staying at a friends condo. The rooms are clean and beautifully decorated with all the ammeinites of home. The front desk and concierge service is excellent and the whole staff very friendly, courteous and professional. The restaurant is fantastic as well. The service is very good and the food and selection good as well. One morninh at breakfast when a large party came in ahead of us it took a bit longer to get our order and the manager came over and gave us our meal at no charge because of the wait and since we were checking out that morning also called the front desk to let them know we were going to be a little late. Our overall experience was excellent and we already have another stay booked next month.

Reviews.Title: “The one bedrooms are awesome”
Reviews.Author: Sundevil08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the room 2205 which is a one bedroom condo. The tub was huge, the room was clean, and the view was really nice. We did have a hot water issue, but management took care of that immediately. The manager that we spoke to was efficient, helpful, and super concerned with the quality of our stay. I really couldn’t ask for more! Overall, the place is beautiful. I am sure your experience will differ depending on your view, but if you can get a room that faces the golf course then you are in luck! It was very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Keep In Mind: Legacy is an exchange resort, not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAofPHX
Reviews.Content: Be aware, Legacy is a vacation exchange resort, not a hotel. Upon arrival, there was no baggage assistance, our luggage was stored in an unlocked conference room since they stuck VERY closely to their 4PM check-in time. The desk staff was not that competent in handling our check-in and room assignment. There is only one restaurant with limited operating hours, and when our large party (10) arrived one evening for dinner about an hour before closing, we were absolutely assured (without us asking!) by the bartender that there was no way he would serve after the 9pm closing time! 9pm, on a Friday night, for a party of 10 (and others already dining)! Not to mention it took a long time to receive our cocktails and 4 of the 8 ordered were incorrect... The pool bar (serving food as well) closed several hours before the sun went down and the crowd diminished. No pool toys or rafts are allowed in the pool, and the "Pool Nazi" made sure you did not bring ANY beverages to the pool area, and hounded you with a copy of the written rules until you left or he took your beverages. The pools was very well maintained, plenty of lounge chairs and towels. The rooms (1-bedroom and 2-bedroom suites) were very well appointed, very clean and well-maintained. They had very good appliances, including a large refrigerator/freezer. The golf course was in very good condition, a good challenge, with free club rental and a very low rate for guests. As long as you are aware of the above, I would recommend Legacy for someone desiring a low-key, quiet get-away to the desert of Arizona. It is a long drive to Scottsdale and many of the other attractions of Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “The Jacuzzi Tub Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: pookybear30
Reviews.Content: It was amazing to have the Jacuzzi tub in my room!! That, in my opinion, is the strongest selling point for me. It makes the whole experience complete. I stayed at the Orange Tree Golf Resort last year (another great hotel by Shell Hospitality) , and so I remembered it was very pleasant and was happy that the Legacy was as well. I wish that every resort had a jacuzzi tub option, but since they don’t, Legacy and Orange Tree have my business every phx trip I make. Very clean too! I actually just booked another stay even though I had an option to stay at the Camelback Inn, because I truly think this hotel is a secret oasis and has much more to offer! The good rates are just a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facilities”
Reviews.Author: GTLEdmonton
Reviews.Content: I needed to get away from the rat race for a nice relaxing holiday somewhere. I found the Legacy Golf Resort on the internet and it seemed to have everything I required. (Sun, golf, pool, easy access to and from the airport, reasonably priced). I guess everything in Arizona would be less expensive in summer due to the heat factor, but even if the cost of the weeks stay was 2 or 3 times more it would be worth it. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. The room exceded my expectations. Very clean and well equiped with whatever one needs. The pool area was no exception, it too was cleaned daily and the area was well equiped and comfortable. The golf course was inexpensive and was a very nice course to play. The course staff were excellent representatives of a first a rate resort. Courteous and helpful in all aspects. I did not use the restaurant, therefore I am unable to comment in that regard, however, in keeping with everything else there, it was probably very good. They also have a very nicely equiped, maintained and air conditioned workout facility for an afternoon workout when the sun heats up to 110. This is a family oriented resort which is something new to me as I generally look for a more adult oriented vacation, however I wouldn't hesitate recommending this resort to anyone. As I am more for accustomed to adult only vacations I may look for something more along those lines in the future, but still give the Legacy Resort full marks overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and services”
Reviews.Author: windsorlily
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from The Legacy having booked 11 nights in a one bedroom condo. All staff were very gracious and very proactive. We particularly booked here for the golf and were not disappointed, Mr Gaffney the manager and the golfing support staff were so professional in all their roles. We had not realised that daily housekeeping was part of the package and here staff really personalised the service with different little touches each day i.e. flannels shaped in various ways, flowers etc. Our only complaint was with the jacuzzi, which if your neighbours above chose to use theirs was extremely noisy. This unfortunately happened at 10:30 pm and 3:30am. The staff did respond quickly to our complaint at 3:30am and the noise ceased. We could not fault the facilities or staff. My husband and I would both recommend this resort to all age ranges.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Steve-Connie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times while in Phoenix. Both the suites and 1 bedroom condos are extremely comfortable and clean. The pool is very nice. The dining room is convenient and the food & service good.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: NiceFunction
Reviews.Content: I arranged a Team Meeting at the Legacy for 14 people. The Event went off without a hitch. The resort is beautiful and the staff very friendly. The catering food was excellent. We only ate at the resorts resaurant 1 time and that was very good. I would stay there again and actually thought about buying a time share just so I could go back. I recieved positive feedback from the entire group. The studio suites were spacious and clean. Bathrooms seem newley updated. I would say the only down side would be that the Pool Bar closes at 5:30 p.m. while the pool stays open until 10p.m. and you can not bring in food or drinks from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Nikke99
Reviews.Content: This was a wondeful experience. The resort staff was lovely, the rooms were perfect, clean, and spacious. We had a 2 bedroom lock-off. There were two external doors and a connecting door. The 'Hotel' side of the lock-off, which I assume can be booked on its on based on the set-up, had a patio, king bed, full bathroom, and a small refrigerator and microwave. The room would be perfect for a solo traveler or a couple. Although it had a sitting area that pulled out into a 2nd bed it wouldn't allow any privacy since it was one open room. The '1bedroom' side of the accomodations had a private bedroom area with master bath including a jacuzzi tub. The condo was quite large, had a full kitchen, a pull out sofa bed in the living room, and a patio. The resort is two levels and does not offer elevators. No daily housekeeping or towel changes. The resort grounds were beautifully kept and they offered an 18-hole golf course, shuffle board, and a gorgeous pool with pool bar. The onsite restaurant and bar were fantastic and were adjacent to the pro shop. The resort is fairly close to the airport, but most other adventures require a drive. We did take a day trip to Sedona, and the beautifully scenic drive took roughly 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, little shade, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelbunnycritic
Reviews.Content: I have to say, as a critic of almost all hotel staff....this place was the best I have experienced.....well...minus the Ritz Carlton. But that is a whole different kind of place. The staff was prompt, they were friendly, and very Polite on the phone. They even call back to make sure the problems, or requests have been taken care of. I was really impressed. Rooms were large enough, table seats 6 (in my room 1 bd) Laundry is handy, but loud. Should have been near entrance way instead. Had to turn up TV to hear at all. I am used to rudeness, no response at all, and horse play from the staff. Instead they were professionals. Amenities are nice. Things that this resort desperately needs. MORE SHADE around the pool. They have umbrellas attached to tables....but not enough trees, or umbrellas to shade the lounge chairs. In the day of skin cancer awareness this is a problem. Wireless for the rooms. Swings for kids playground. (more shade) The only real mishap we had was not being able to check into our room for 2 hours past check in time. Housecleaning had not gotten to it yet....and repairs were being done. We went to Botanical Gardens, Zoo, and Arizona Mills Mall, and Lake Pleasant. I recommend all these for your trip there. Lake Pleasant is at least 30 mins away. But the rest are about 5-7 miles away. To Eat: PLEASE go to the FARM which is located practically next door. They have 3 types of restaurants.....one for breakfast, one for lunch (picnic style) and fance dinner restaurant. You will feel like you are on a retreat. They have plenty of WIDE open space with grass, and in the distance they have the chickens, and veggies growing. The food is made and grown there....so fresh is for sure. Also...please check out the Secret Garden Restaurant VINTAGE MARKET...similar retreat type feel. Koi pond, and old 1929 spanish colonial home....with huge grassy "park" like area connected to restaurant. (meant for weddings). Ok....married 7 years....but if I were to get married again these are the 2 places that would be excellent choices for receptions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Legacy Golf Resort”
Reviews.Author: cater2
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the Legacy Golf Resort. The one bedroom condo was immaculate, spacious and easily accessible. I was graciously greeted at registration by Nicole (who has a sparkling peronality). She was very attentive to my requests (as were the other staff that I encountered during my stay) The property is conviently located minutes from the airport and the downtown area (but you wouldn't know that when you are at the resort). I highly reccommend this property and as a frequently business travelor to the area plan to visit this property twice to three times a month.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: FarmBride08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Legacy Golf Resort the weekend we got married. We also recommended the resort to our guests that were traveling from out of state. It was absolutely perfect and all our guests agreed. The resort itself is beautiful and they keep the grounds immaculate. We opted for the bigger of the two rooms offered and it worked out great that weekend. It had a full kitchen and separate living/dining area. It was perfect for myself and my two bridesmaids, moms, hairdresser, and makeup artist to all get ready for the big day. It was very comfortable and almost felt like we were getting ready at home. It was also nice to relax in the big two person jacuzzi tub each evening. If you are looking to get away for the weekend and suggest somewhere for out of town guests we would highly recommend the Legacy. Staying at the Legacy completed our fairytale wedding weekend!!! We look forward to coming back to celebrate our one year anniversary. Alisa and Bryan

Reviews.Title: “Guys golfing had great time”
Reviews.Author: WindshearDon
Reviews.Content: The sun shone brightly and the Legacy did likewise on most counts. We were a party of four guys out for a week of golfing. We had a 2-bedroom unit which provided two sofa beds in addition to king beds - it would have been nicer to have a better sleeping option. The place was exceptionally well-maintained with beautiful landscaping. The units were spacious and well-equipped. Maintenance was called twice - for a leaking pipe and a dislodged screen door and they fixed both quickly. The housecleaning was a bit sporadic but a phone call fixed that. The grounds are quite large and the common area can be a bit far from some units. The common BBQ area was a disappointment. There should be more spread around the property. The pool, hot tub and lighted tennis courts are all first-class. We golfed here once and the course is in magnificent shape with truly intimidating bunkers. There is a nice restaurant but we didn't dine there this time. The Legacy is about 4 miles south of Sky Harbor but the air traffic was hardly heard and there is no road noise so you have an isolated feeling. The neighbourhood is OK and travel is fast as the freeways are within a couple of miles. We are definitely planning a return trip - the Legacy is a fine resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great golf, no-so-great complex”
Reviews.Author: GolferIdaho
Reviews.Content: If there was not a need to stay at the resort for the Vision54 golf school, we would not use the Legacy. There is only one restaurant and the beds/pillows were terrible. To call themselves a resort, they need to be more high end -- they need fluffy, large towels, assorted pillows, decent beds. We only paid $119 so at least the price was right. Also, we found out when we were leaving that the resort is located in a bad part of town - scary. If we went back to the golf school (which was fantastic) we'd stay somewhere else and drive in each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Happy returning customer”
Reviews.Author: golfguy23
Reviews.Content: Great resort with wonderful staff and GREAT golf course!! Was there 3 years ago and am returning this month for a week of relaxation with my family. I really don't know where the previous reviewer is coming from. He really doesn't give a solid base for his negativity. This place is great and I highly recommend the restaurant, staff and accommodations. The golf course has some aspects of a desert track but fairways are generous and all levels of players should be able to enjoy it. I take my teenage girls and wife to play and they love it. Looking forward to my next stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “$300 resort? I don't think so!”
Reviews.Author: TR-Den
Reviews.Content: I paid $300 a night for this place? Give me a break! This property is not close to what I would have expected for a rate such as this. Even at $150 a night, you can do better elsewhere. Pros: Clean rooms Nice landscaping Polite front desk staff Kitchens in the room (if that is something that you want) Good food at the clubhouse Apartment style layout for privacy Big deck off the room Good golf course Washer & Dryer in the room DVD rentals in the loby Cons: Way overpriced for what you get No two bed configurations (only 1 bed with a sleeper sofa) Annoying timeshare salespeople No valet No room service No bellman Cheap mattress, linens and towels Maids did not come to clean my room until after 3:30pm Not enough parking close to your room Location of the property 1980’s cabinetry in the kitchen No pay-per view

Reviews.Title: “never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: BitTraffic
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the "Legacy" Golf Resort was terrible.. There was blood, yes blood in our bathroom, and a long black hair on our bath towel!! :| When we called the manager, Andrew, he came to our room to verify our claim.. along with the executive housekeeper.. They were both very appalled and look amazingly disgusted as we were, they had house cleaning come up, which arrived at 9:30, and was still cleaning at 11, when we had to check out.. needless to say, we got dressed in secrecy, and did not get to take a shower! when we left our room, she was STILL CLEANING. above and beyond that they did not offer absolutely anything to accommodate for it! but hoped it would not change our opinion of the legacy! The representative "Kami" with "Shell Vacations Resort" was RUDE & unprofessional. I have never in my life had an experience with such a person. We regret staying at the legacy, will not be returning, and would advise you not to either!

Reviews.Title: “Vision 54 @ Legacy Golf Resort”
Reviews.Author: PhoebeSoCA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Legacy Golf Resort to attend the Vision 54 golf class hosted at the site. My studio room was clean, comfortable, and reasonably well-maintained. It also had a nice view out to the golf course. The kitchenette made it very easy to take care of meals, and the resort did a really good job coordinating with the golf school for cart and course usage, mid-day meals, club storage, and more. The golf course itself was in excellent shape and set up to be both playable and challenging for players of all levels. I did not get a chance to take advantage of all the ammenities that the resort offers, as my time was pretty well committed to the golf class, but there appeared to be a nice pool, shuffleboard, and the concierge service was running regular events and excursions. Overall, a really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller than website shows; but stil a great value!”
Reviews.Author: lorriv20
Reviews.Content: I was slightly disapointed whne we first entered the door, because the room was smaller than it appeared on the web site photos. However, the disapointment did not last long. The one bedroom condo was still a fantastic room. The bathroom was wonderful. The walk in shower was large enough for two, as was the whirlpool tub, which was a great stress buster at the end of the day. The kitchen was fully stocked and contained everything you could possibly need. The in room washer and dryer allowed me to retuen home with clean laundry. I was also very pleased with the level of customer service that was provided. It was prompt and polite, and everything we needed was provided with a smile. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Legacy”
Reviews.Author: Superstitious_SAK
Reviews.Content: We three "ladies of a certain age" enjoy vacationing at The Legacy every summer (when the prices are a bargain). The accommodations are wonderful, and the staff friendly. Our last visit was memorable, in that we had to wait quite a bit to check into our rooms. The previous guest had not checked out on schedule. We were kept waiting in an adjacent room while the room was cleaned, sterilized, and the coroner and hearse had left the property. Being level headed ladies, we had no problem sharing our space with the departed spirit, but we were disturbed by the soaking wet carpet. We had to request mattress pads to walk upon to avoid slipping and breaking our necks on the soapy floors. A couple of days after check in, one of the ladies and I went out shopping, leaving our hard of hearing friend to nap. When we returned, we discovered that we had locked ourselves out, and no amount of door pounding would wake up our friend. The security fellow who came to our aid, looked peaked when we explained our situation, and asked if our friend had any ailments, how old was she, etc......I knew he was thinking of the previous guest. "Lordy lordy, not again". Our "room mate" was a quiet type, and after the carpets dried, the four of us had a nice week together. We plan to return as soon as possible.....but we think our roomie has "crossed over".

Reviews.Title: “It was okay...”
Reviews.Author: EveOntario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here not for the golf but for the spa benefits and great corporate rate they gave us. It was well located, close to malls, highways etc. Once we arrived, we were impressed by how well the grounds were kept and how large the complex was. Beautiful view from our room of the South Mountain. The pool was clean, people who worked there were friendly and professional. However, there were some issues with noise with thin walls between units. Also, the room we were in had a patio door facing the main driveway, (we were on the 2nd floor) and the noise from cars and golf carts driving back and forth was a little disturbing, especially around the end of the day. Also, the room needed to be refurbished and carpet cleaned. I must also reiterate though that the staff was very happy to help and very accomodating. When we arrived for an early check-in, we were mistakenly given a room that had just been checked out of a few hours prior, so everything was a mess! However, we were offered another room but we said we would wait AND we were also given free lunch at the restaurant. Not too bad a place, really, even if you don't golf! Laura from Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay !!”
Reviews.Author: longball44
Reviews.Content: We booked the Legacy through Preferred Access and really enjoyed our one week stay. At first we had a studio but upgraded to a 1 bedroom after walking through the models of each. It would be easy to stay in a studio here but the 1 bedroom feels more like your own home. Lots of parking, the on site restaurant is small but the food is great. Staff if friendly too. Washer & dryer in each room (even the studios) and the full kitchen is nice and has everything you need. Go buy some groceries and move right in. There is a Fry's market about 1 1/2 miles away. Only downsize to this resort is no free Internet in the rooms. You have to pay $9.95 per day to get online. Pretty much in the middle of the Phoenix area with easy freeway access. Quiet and clean rooms. We will definitely be back to The Legacy.

Reviews.Title: “Well-Kept Secret - Super Stay!”
Reviews.Author: btowndude
Reviews.Content: I booked through Priceline and got the studio for $40 a night. I upgraded to a one bedroom suite. These are time-share condos - the studio is the one bedroom "lockout" unit - and - the one bedroom is the larger unit with full kitchen. These units are clustered into two story, eight plex units with no elevator. I had a nice view of the golf course from the living room, dining room, and bedroom. I agree with all the positive statements made in prior reviews. The only negatives are: (1) There are only six parking spaces for every eight rooms. On Saturday nights, it is not unusual for some one to host a party and the guests use up most of the parking spaces. I counted 24 cars at 2 am with no parking permit last Saturday night. Security made no attempt to police the parking problem. So, if you plan to enjoy some of the nightlife, be prepared for a long walk from the golf course parking lot back to your condo; and (2) Housekeeping did not clean my room for the last two days of my stay. I did complain, but their solution was for me to leave my room from 6 pm - 7 pm so they had time to clean. Since they had from noon until 5 pm to clean, I did not go along with that solution. They gave me new towels only after a long discussion, but did not empty the trash. Although there is no wi-fi or free internet, there is free access to a computer with a printer in the lobby. It was great to print out my boarding passes, while waiting to check out. Also, if you have dial-up, the phone call is only fifty cents for an unlimited call. Typical of a time share, there was a king-size bed in the bedroom and a queen-size sofa bed in the living room. However, there were only two drawers and one small closet. Thankfully, there was lots of floor space to lay out suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: miken515
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at the Legacy twice in the last month. The facillities and accomodations were top notch and were especially great considering the reasonable price. We will definately be staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “loved the suites”
Reviews.Author: genekath
Reviews.Content: The room was great, food excellent, and a great golf course. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Laud the Legacy”
Reviews.Author: apops
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting the Legacy Golf Resort on 32nd St. in Phoenix regularly for the past 3 years and plan to continue to do so in the future. In comparison to other resorts in the "Valley of the Sun" I find that their golf course, accommodations, ammenities, and staff represent the Valley's best golf resort value by far. The golf course is kept in superb shape even in the heat of summer. The course is challenging, but a fair test for golfers of any ability. The practice facilities are extensive. The golf shop has a great selection of golf apparel, and you get a 25% discount just for filling out a questionaire. Swimming pool, restaurant, tennis, sand volleyball, hot tub, are also on property. Each morning guests have announcements on voice mail of planned activities available for that day. A one bedroom condo, will provide you with everything you need for a short or extended stay. Washer, drier, complete kitchens, stereo, 2 TV's, double vanity sink, jetted tub, separate room with standing shower and another single vanity sink, dishwasher, balcony, and dining area. Even the studios have dishwashers, washers, driers, fridge, sink, microwave, and 2 burner range. The area around the Legacy has restaurants at Arizona Mills Mall, movie theaters, and other attractions close by. Finally, I have found the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff to be all that a guest could ask for. Carol who has taken my reservations, to the girls at the registration check in desk, to Louie and Joe who are starters on the course, to Moto, one of the cart guys, to Nick Zell who has given me a lesson or two, to Chris, the head pro, to Chris Morrow in time share sales -- There are others, I just don't know all their names. The impression I get is that their friendliness is sincere. They come across as real people, being nice because that is the way they are, rather than the robotic types that "serve" you because they are paid to do so at other resorts I have visited. I look forward to my future visits. Nick, next we tackle the short game. lol Submitted by Allan Popsack

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Legacy”
Reviews.Author: Que-z
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding in April and booked a 1 bedroom unit at the Legacy Golf Resort for the weekend. We requested a unit close to the pool, on the 2nd floor with a view. I was plesantly surprised upon check-in that all my requests had been met. We loved our unit, it was very spacious, new kitchen, huge bathroom with jacuzzi, nice patio over looking the pool and golf area with a comfortable living room and dining room. I was sorry we had to check out after 2 days, I would have liked to have spent more time there. We travel to the Phoenix area several times a year to visit family and I wouldn't hesitate to return to the Legacy.

Reviews.Title: “Just doesnt get any better”
Reviews.Author: LOCK410
Reviews.Content: WOW!! That had to have been the most relaxing 10 days of our lives. We upgraded from a suite to a 1 bedroom and it was beautiful. Every staff member made us feel at home, the grounds keepers, maids, concierge service, desk clerks, everyday would say "Good morning" How are you? We know that this is a golf resort but we booked it for tennis. Great tennis courts! We would be up at 5:00 am on the courts by 5:30 done by 8:00, pool side by 9:00 to 11:00. Then enjoy the comfort of our air conditioned room. My daughter is 16 and my son is 14, there was more then enough room for the family of 4. Very large kitchen, livingroom, 1 bedroom and the best part was the jacuzzi tub. This old man used it every night. The activites are endless, great dining real authentic Mexican cusine, grocery stores and malls all with 15 minutes. South mountain park is a must and can be veiwed from the pool. Hiking and seeing ancient Indian petroclives and an abundance wild life. Every thing is so well maintained and I personally loved the Weight room. So treat yourself to a wonderfull time. We did.

Reviews.Title: “New rules--no bar service for the pool after 6 PM”
Reviews.Author: BajaMermaid
Reviews.Content: Four of us decided to enjoy Sunset by the pool with a few Margaritas. We went to dinner at a local restaurant and arrived at the pool near 6 PM. The guys in the group went to get drinks and were directed by the bartender to go to the clubhouse, as the pool bar was closing. The clubhouse told them that their liquor license did not allow them to serve us drinks to take to the pool. I questioned the bartender, who was very rude, and asked for a manager. The Manager, Ryan, confirmed that the concession to the restaurant and the pool bar had been sold to different parties effective Jan 2006. As a result, liquor laws did not allow them to serve liquor in the other location. We actually observed the pool staff confiscate someone else's drink. Later, we left the pool and went to the clubhouse for drinks and appetizers. Karen, an excellent waitress, indicated that while they could give us drinks in plastic cups to take to our room, we shouldn't take them to the pool because they would be taken from us. I can't imagine that a resort would expected vacationers not to enjoy a drink by the pool at sunset. It is an essential part of the vacation experience for me.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: CoCoSandy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful stay at the Legacy Golf Resort. I'm not a golfer, but we got a great deal on Expedia, so we booked it and what a wonderful place. Check in was a little crowded, but other than waiting in line for that, we had a wonderful time. We had the basic studio suite (whatever they call it) and it was LOVELY...we had a balcony overlooking the golf course. (We noticed that some units overlook the parking lot, so if you stay here, you might request the golf course view, though we didn't and got it nonetheless.) The pool was really nice and big, in an interesting shape. I got up early and walked the golf course grounds and saw bunnies and took endless photos of the gorgeous palm trees. We saved a lot of money because the unit had a full kitchen, dishwasher and all and a supermarket about a mile away, on Baseline. All in all, we loved this place and would want to go back if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but some things that you need to be aware of”
Reviews.Author: MacDaddyOmaha
Reviews.Content: First off, the resort is pretty nice. The facilities are very well maintained. Rooms are not very big, walls are very thin. The pool is a bit smaller than the pictures depict and is usually a bit of a walk from most rooms (music is a bit loud also). The weird part is were it's built. This is no Scottsdale!. The surrounding neighborhood is a bit rough to say the least. With that in mind you would expect there would be a security gate at the entrance, but low-and-behold there isn't. There are a few resteraunts on Baseline road, but for the most part your going to have to take a bit of a drive to find a decent place to eat. The golf course was the real savior here. Staff was great, course was very well maintained (even considering it was June), and very challenging

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: mlehman
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Legacy. The grounds were beautiful, well kept. We stayed in a one bedroom unit. The unit was nice but the walls are thin. We could hear our neighbors talking. The restaurant was good. We ate there for breakfast and dinner. We tried on numerous occasions to call the conceirge but no one ever answered. When we called the front desk to ask our question she said she didn't know the answer and would transfer us to the conceirge. When he answered the phone all he said was "ask someone else" and hung up. I would say that was our only negative experience we had while staying there. When we ran out of coffee we walked to the front desk and asked for more and by the time we got back to our unit the coffee was waiting. When our toilet became clogged they had someone to our unit within minutes. Overall we had a great experience at the Legacy except for the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Handy golf to airport.”
Reviews.Author: Trustingtraveler
Reviews.Content: This resort has a great golf facility, with excelent golf staff. The rooms all have kitchens which are needed as the restaurant has limited service. The 2nd floor studio suites all appear to be located under loud mechanical devices, which would rate these rooms 2 star. The resort otherwise would be 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently POOR service.”
Reviews.Author: DTFISHER55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding in mid-April 2007. The property is great looking. The golf course is amazing. The pool is very nice. We will NOT be back! Why? Customer Service. They have 18 year olds running the place. There was one person at check-in. No rooms were ready before 400pm. A lot of guests were waiting to check-in around the pool all day. We all talked and we all had "early check-in" requests. The concierge was a 20 year old girl that spent her days emailing and text messaging on her cell phone. We would ask her a question and she would not even look up away from her phone. Mind you, we paid $109 a night because we were part of the wedding group, but I would have gladly paid more and stayed at the nearby Marriott resort. Seriously, do NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To STay”
Reviews.Author: FLplanner8
Reviews.Content: The last week in March, we had a conference at a nearby hotel and used The Legacy Golf Resort for guest room overflow. The hotel was extremely willing to assist our members with all of their needs and everyone who stayed there found the accommodations and staff delightful. We would definitely use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Legacy compared to Marriott Canyon Villas”
Reviews.Author: KJOakPark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott Canyon Villas (CV) in Scottsdale on a 3-day timeshare promotion. The Marriott was okay, but the CV we stayed in was quite cramped. The hall leading to our room was stark concrete, poorly lighted from the parking lot. You felt like you were in a crowded apartment building. It did not feel comfortable to walk, felt like a parking lot everywhere. You can use the JW Marriott across the road but you have to drive over or take a shuttle. We drove, then had a fairly healthy hike from the parking lot to the huge facility. Everything is huge, crowded, corporate. In contrast, we finished up our stay at the Legacy Golf Resort. The Legacy is a pleasant place, very well maintained. The rooms are larger and nicer than the Marriott. It feels human, pleasant to walk around, nice scale. While we liked the Wildfire Faldo course at the Marriott, the golf course at Legacy is very nice too, and probably a bit more challenging though comparable and much cheaper. The little restaurant in the club had a great veranda and very good food and service. The workout facilities were fine. A few blocks away is the Farm at South Mountain, 3 charming restaurants in one location for breakfast, lunch and dinner. We had a great breakfast there. All in all, we liked the Legacy better.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, Great hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: TaylorC.
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and this year we landed in Phoenix in anticipation of staying at the Legacy Golf Resort. We've heard a lot about the resort from my husband's golf buddies. Overall the trip was great. The hotel was very clean, the staff went over and above for us, the rooms were spacious and nicely decorated. Overall we were very happy and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Legacy Customer Service is Sub-Standard”
Reviews.Author: OldBlueTortoise
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a suite at the Legacy Golf Resort in Phoenix and had one of the worst customer service experiences that we have ever experienced during our travels. Upon check-in, the staff appeared to have little time to check in the guests that had arrived. After waiting in line for approximately half an hour, we were told that our room was not ready and there was no clear indication given when it would be ready. Upon further inquiry, including a request to speak to the management, we were finally given a room number and told that we could check in when house-keeping was finished cleaning the room. The reason given for the delay was that the previous guests had checked out late and the Resort had no control over this. However, as we approached our suite, we noticed that several of the other suites were still in the process of being cleaned, leading us to believe that the Resort was under-staffed. One of the points made by management while we were booking the suite was the fact that we would love the room and it was worth the wait because we would have a wonderful view of the mountains / golf course from our upper balcony. When we were finally able to occupy the room, we stepped onto the balcony and had a wonderful view....of two Large Eucalyptus trees...which totally blocked any other view. We have booked suites at this resort several times in the past and are very reluctant to do so in the future because of the poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: LoveTaa_Travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at the Legacy. I must say, I was pleasantly pleased. I booked the resort through Expedia about 2 months prior to departure.
